Name: The Stone Man - A Science Fiction Horror Novel

ReviewList.Text: This ebook was fantastic and totally different from any other sci-fi thriller I've ever read. Very original story. I love that some of it was written like a diary then brought you to the present. Without spoilers I must say that this is the first book that instead of making me afraid of the dark it made me afraid to be living. I kept thinking, "what if.... what if .....". I kept feeling like maybe a hole in the ground somewhere might make me feel safe. I liked that the main character Andy was so human. Who couldn't relate to someone in that extreme situation. The author pushed this character from feeling special to feeling cursed. You  didn't want to be him after a while. Because I've read so much sci-fi, I personally could predict what the next move might be but you are never sure until it happens. It was a wild ride. Glad I have a strong heart.

The story is actually pretty good. What I disliked was the lack of editing. Unfortunately many many textual and spelling errors throughout the document. Regardless, the story is good enough for me to Luke's other book.

If ten words can make a point, this author uses a hundred. Every point is repeated, again  and again. Many errors of basic science and math, ie, the perimeter ' was a square over three hundred feet in diameter'. This author either has or plans to write more sci-fi to include physics???

The story telling in the book was fantastic. I found myself easily hooked into the book and constantly questioning, "why, what's next, how??" In my opinion, the author wasted no time getting right into the thick of the story and from there he kept up the action pretty well! There seems to be some concern with pretty minor grammar/spelling issues, in the reviews. I found that these were easily overlooked as the story telling was excellent! I think there is plenty enough information in the story summary to help you decide if you're interested in reading and some of these reviews attempt to ruin a surprise ending. :( I'm glad I didn't read any reviews before I read the book.. as I was pleasantly surprised by the ending. I will definitely be choosing another book by this author as my next read.

Luke Smitherd clearly knows how to capture the imagination of his readers from page 1 - I genuinely could not put this book down. Other-worldly concepts have never really been my thing but The Stone Man has a realism in the writing that takes you in and doesn't let go until the last word in the book. A great read for the summer!

What a waste of space on my Kindle! Not to mention any trees that had to be cut down to put this nonsense into a paperback. It had possibly the least likeable protagonist of anything I've read in the last 10 years. The inner monologue of Andy just goes on and on and on and on, oh and then on some more with no actual insight or original thought. The author describes a scene or emotion one time then does so again and again as though it is giving the reader some deeper meaning to what his character is supposed to feeling when it is really just nauseating. We get it, he's confused by what's happening don't need to have it broken down for us over and over. If this book is supposed to be a "thriller" or "horror" the people who put it that category must have found The Bridges of Madison County to be one of the most edge of your seats capers of the last century. Pure B.S.  As much as the ASOIAF series has made me love reading once again and led me to becoming a fan of many more authors and genres, this book made me lose faith in the Amazon recommendations and made me question whether or not to take chances on lesser known authors like Smitherd with my money.  Smitherd and Amazon we are all dumber for having read this book, I award you no points and may God have mercy on your soul.
I was so engaged in both the characters and the story.  I can so totally see this as a movie.

and I read alot. I found this book almost impossible to put down. When I finally did - it was after midnight and I had to work the next day - I found myself mulling options, trying to figure out endings, see where it was going, how it would finish. It was a heart pounding, adriniline rush of a read. Great Job Luke!!!

A fairly original conceit, but way too much interior monologue from the protagonist.  Every time the interior ranting started, I simply skipped a few pages, and don't seem to have missed anything. In the context of an alien invasion, we don't really care about the protagonists focus on becoming a media hero.

I've only ever abandoned one book. The Stone Man by Luke Smitherd. It's billed as a "Science Fiction Thriller" but it just drags on and on. 1/3th of the way through and it feels like everything that happened in that 1/3 should have been covered in three pages. It took me a while to even get that far through it, despite reading it in an airport where there's nothing else to do. I kept reading it that long because it's got really good reviews and is even a "#1 Amazon Best Seller"....I just couldn't keep going. I'm sorry.

Finally, a real sci-fi thriller novel written by an adult, for adults! A fresh and interesting story line with well developed, believable, non-cliched characters.  Gave it 4 stars but I am comparing this to the stuff from the established, big-name writers. This novel is 10 stars compared to the other self published stuff I have read.
I was caught up in this book,could not put it down until I finished it.I could feel Paul's fear and the steps of the Stone Man.This book is well written and scary.I look forward to the next book.
This book is intriguing, causing me to stay up late last night, buy the author's other books and joining his mailing list!  Highly recommended.
Really enjoyed this novel. A talented writer in my opinion will now download his previous work with a sense of expectation of a good read.

If you like Dean Koontz, and gentler Steven King.  Great premise.  I identified with the main characters.  Kept thinking--put the targets on a ship and lead the stone man through the oceans (walking across ocean floor) forever--until end of targets' natural lifespans. Then, do it again for the next visit.  However, author put- an -end to that strategy by putting a small-area barrier around each target.  Finally the ending strategy fell in line with the obvious solution, so I was no longer frustrated!  Exciting!  Looking forward to next book I will read by him.  His easy, natural conversational style among the protagonists, made reading this book very fluid and enjoyable.  He deserves to be picked up by a major publisher and movie producers!! Only, please drop the F word, which I know is pervasive among people, today.  There do not seem to be any other offensive words, though bollocks ( I had to look up), is offensive to Brits, I didn't know what it meant-literally. Characters do reflect, unfortunately, the selfishness prevalent in so many.
Excellent read, could not put it down.  Creative and not a predictable premise or ending. character development is on point and Smitherd gets you to empathize with his antagonists.

The story was strong and different.  However the story is in bad need of editing for sentence structure and blurbs like tapping his foot on the floor, when the whole paragraph has been about the person being outside.
I read a lot and was amazed to find a book that was like nothing else I've ever read! I can easily see this one being turned into a movie.

I have to admit - I'm not exactly sure how this book even ended up on my Kindle.  I believe my wife downloaded it when it was offered free at some point.  I don't get a chance to read for pleasure much any more, but I was on vacation and the title caught my eye when I was browsing through a bunch of titles she had uploaded onto my device.  Couldn't put the book down and I thoroughly enjoyed reading about the well-developed characters.  I thought it was a unique story and it had a few nice twists to the plot.  Since then, I just finished the first part of the Black Room and enjoyed that as well.  I guess I am now a full-fledged 'Smithereen'.
Loved the premise - but the poor writing turned me off this book about 1/3 of the way through.

I really, REALLY liked this book. I loved the ending!  It is a real page turner and kept my interest all the way through. The way he wrote their thought processes was very realistic and natural. As another reviewer wrote "it was ultimately a very human story".  I recommend this to any sci-fi or horror fan. His style of writing is very smooth and I think this would make a great movie. I am sure I will be reading more from this author.  (Only one thing bothered me;  his frequent us of "whilst".  Just me I guess!  It must be a word used in the UK that I am not used to hearing)

An original story, interesting, and the writing itself is fine, but this book could use a good editor.  Some novels are driven by the beauty of the prose; but a story-driven sci/fi novel becomes tedious if the breaks in the action include pages of rummaging around in the characters' inner monologue.  The main character is not interesting enough to have a juicy history of flashbacks or sins in his head - just the usual "am I a nice guy?  No, I'm not a nice guy.  Well, I'm sort of a nice guy...nah" back and forth that everyone does in traffic or in line for coffee.

A horrifying story that only a very imaginative mind could create, the unstoppable stone man. He simply appears out of nowhere one day and is totally impervious to all of humanity's weapons.  He destroys everything in his path and no one can figure how to stop him. What he wants is unbelievable and very frightening. He is in two people's minds who can't control or shut him out. His invasion into people's minds drives others completely crazy. How is this resolved I am unsure if it can last. Can you be sure?

I am a 63 year-old grandmother, and have been reading science fiction for over 50 years.  It is not often that I find a writer who has as many fresh ideas and plot lines as Luke.  I have read most of his books, and only ask that they keep coming.  TSM was  the first one of his that I read, and I recommend everyone else to read it first, also.  His characters are realistic, his writing style easy to read, and there is enough humor to make even the most uncomfortable moments bearable.

Very interesting story about a so-so reporter who needs a great scoop in order to be a recognized name.  His chance comes when he comes across a large statue of a stone man in a field in his city.  At first the stone man is unmoving but then begins to walk, destroying everything that is in his way.  The reporter decides to follow it knowing that this is a story that will put him 'on the map."  However, the price he has to pay for the fame he gains, is far from what he expected.

This tale is not so much a scifi book as it is in the "monster/horror" genre. Some may like this type of reading but personally I have lost interest in novels that are built around characters or entities which are too unrealistic or improbable to exist (like the stone man). Looking through the other reviews I see a majority were not very impressed with this book either. While some may disagree, 3-Stars (It's okay) is the best I could do

I don’t write negative reviews but in the interest of my fellow Amazon readers I need to write a warning and identify false labeling. The Stone Man is nothing more than writing exercise in creating nonstop meaningless dialog. The positive reviews, they must be the products of a creative writing workshop somewhere in the UK. I am angry with Amazon for recommending this book and for wasting my time.

The concept and depiction of the Stone Man are great, but the plot needs some serious work. There is a huge let-down near the end (which involves one of the cardinal sins of fiction plotting, by the way) which threw me out of the story completely. Point of view is crucial - if one hews closely to a given point of view, it must be maintained to the very end of the work. This work doesn't do that.

Characters and locations are very well done, and the main focus is quite creative, but the ending is non-existent. Throughout the book I was looking forward to discovering what sort of entity sent the stone man and why, but ~ NOTHING. It is as if Smitherd had a good concept for the main body but could not come up with an appropriate ending and decided to publish it anyway.
The book has an intereresting premise, is fairly fast paced but the ending seemed abrupt, as if the author go stuck and had to end it. The Alternate ending was worse.
I kept waiting for the action. There was a bit if redemption in which character becomes the hero and why. Interesting concept but poorly executed.
The story was very confusing at first but it made a little sense about half way.  I did not like the ending.
I had so many things I should have done but couldn't put down tilI reached the end. I am already purchasing his other books.
there were a few loose ends, however, and I found myself wondering "why a square?" at the end... or, "Who?" in general.
I thoroughly enjoyed this book. Although based on a simple premise, Smitherd weaves an engaging, complex tale that keeps you guessing through his excellent character descriptions and dialogues..

This is one of the most original stories I've read in years. I got sucked into it very quickly and never knew what was going to happen next. So naturally I kept tapping the next page button as quickly as I could. Mr. Smitherd is, I think, a natural storyteller. The main characters are very well-drawn and their actions quite reasonable and believable. For Mr. Smitherd (if you're reading): I especially liked the Brigadier. Very sharp. Very professional. And compassionate when allowed. Also for Mr. Smitherd (if you're reading and since you asked), the only real issue I had with the military aspect was, when you finish transmitting on a radio you say "over". When you're completely finished with the radio conversation, you say "out". Saying "over and out" isn't correct. I hate to be picky but you did ask! I'll be looking for more books from Mr. Smitherd. I think he has a natural talent and quite simply, I haven't read such a fresh sci-fi-thriller-horror story in a long, long time.

The plot was excellent, original and I loved the unexpected ending. This book had suspense broken up with bits of humor. The Stone Man was well written and an easy read.  I recommend the book to those who enjoy an absorbing sci-fi story.  I look forward to reading more of this author's work.
Great classic sci-fi with natural, believable reactions from the protagonists, the public and the government.  Several great twists.  You'll love it.

A good sci-fi tale with some similarity to classic alien invasion novels, but some unique surprises as well. I liked the main characters, and the perspective they gave on the Stone Man and why he may have come to Earth.

I generally enjoy Horror stories with a little Sci-fi thrown in for good measure.  However, after reading the synopsis, I took a chance on just Sci-Fi... and am glad I did.  Although this book has no Horror as we think of it today, it has plenty of emotional horror, great Sci-F and solid characters.  I am perplexed by some of the reviews I read prior to purchase with qualms like:  there wasn't an ending and/or explanation (yes, there were and both were quite good - unsettling but good), there were typos (admittedly a pet peeve of mine for dinging a book review, but really - this book had very few) and that it was slow to start (huh?).  This last point I really don't understand because personally, I appreciate the time to get to know the protagonist -- it makes me actually care what happens to him/her when chaos begins!  Whereas I can appreciate a book that starts with chaos and then you learn something about the characters, it's just not the same.  This book did not take too long to get the action started but did give you time to care (and I thought I was impatient!).  Anyway, if you are looking for a great original Sci-fi book to lose yourself in for a few hours, you can't go wrong with The Stone Man.

Very good story.  I got it while it was free (I am a "free" addict!) and liked it so much that I went ahead and purchased all four installments of The Black Room and also The Man on Table Ten.  Well worth it!

I REALLY did not want this story to end.  My compliments to the author.  I was hooked early on, your characters were completely believable, plot was solid and believable.  I have been reading science fiction for 40 years, and yours stacks up well against the 'greats.'  Please consider apocalyptic or dystopian fiction, …. I do love a good 'after the final war' story and you could write good ones.  Thanks for a great foray into someone else's world.  I will look for you on Facebook!  (Being a lady of a certain age I wasn't a fan of some of the language, but it did fit the story, so I won't gripe about that.)
The Stone Man is a fresh story with a fresh narrative. SciFi and aliens, yes, but not "spacey." The ending is delightfully unexpected.

This was a really well written engaging science fiction novel. It reminded me of early Ray Bradbury. I loved that the premise of the stone man was not predictable. The plot was fresh and exciting. I picked this one because it was free on Amazon but, I will be buying Mr. Smitherd's other titles.

I really enjoyed The Stone Man. I felt the characters were developed in an honest, real manner and their actions, fears and thoughts were believable and (often) endearing. The story was a psychological one more so than heinous action and it suited me perfectly. The writer's "style was very much to my liking and yes, I will be reading more.

I got it free on my Kindle, enjoyed it enough to pay for his other books. Intriguing concept and well written. Kept me involved and I wanted to know more. There are enough other better reviews that I won't go into details of the story. Keep writing Luke.

Loved this book, the flow was excellent and always kept you wondering what would happen next. Very different and imaginative concept, excellent dialogue, and treated military characters with respect and dignity.

The author weaves a highly believable tale of an entirely unbelievable situation. The characters are real people and you get to know them as they face real personal challenges ... Their reactions and choices will give you much to consider. The Stone Man could appear anywhere ... Any day!
I couldn't put the damned thing down once the chase started. A science fiction thriller right to the very end.

“The Stone Man” will have you swiping page after page until you get to the, well, extremely clever ending. As Paul says – it is an extremely simple solution (if not problematic for Paul).This is very good Sci-Fi and yes it is a thriller. I highly recommend it and no Luke, I didn’t notice any typos (or incorrect use of English grammar), something I find in so many e-books.
Truly a gem among low cost kindle books! I really enjoyed reading the story and found it to keep me interested right through to the end.

I have to say that this was a very interesting read for me. I couldn't put it down. The characters are realistic, human, flawed, sympathetic (in that I sympathized easily with them).  I highly recommend this book to adults who enjoy smart, funny characters & sci-fi

It took me quite a bit to get into this book but once I did it was fine. The beginning takes a bit to grab you as it can be slow and not provide alot of detail in my opinion, but afterwards it was nice. I wish there had been a second book as a follow-up to this one to explain a few things that they left hanging, but I guess we can't win them all.

Loved this book, the flow was excellent and always kept you wondering what would happen next.  Very different and imaginative concept, excellent dialogue, and treated military characters with respect and dignity.
The Stone Man starts strong and keeps you turning pages throughout the book. I enjoyed the narrative and the switch is unexpected.  Highly recommended.
What a story...it turned out much different than expected, and in a good way. I really enjoyed the characterization and the twists in the plot. Well done!

I've never read anything like this before and it really gripped me. I loved the idea of the stone man and the mystery surrounding it. In general it's very well written and kept me wanting more and more. The characters are flawed and at first I didn't really like the main one. There are a couple of parts that I didn't feel belonged in the book and felt awkward (sleeping with another mans wife just didn't do anything for the story and felt 'slotted in'). However the whole premise is so clever that you end up overlooking this. Great story, very realistic and I want to know more!

i never write reviews, i hate writing them! so let me start off by saying i am sick of the same old sifi books that have the same events happen just with different creatures. This is not one of those books. i was very pleased to realize that this book had original ideas. thank you for a great read, i will be recommending your book

The Stone Man was a thought-provoking read and I had difficulty putting it down. I am a sci-fi fan and it fit perfectly into the genre. The concept was terrifying and the moral dilemmas that arose with the subject manner were well thought out. I couldn't help but wonder what I would do in the situation that each character faced. I definitely recommend that you give it a try!

I was held captive by this book for hours, literally did not want to put it down! Loved the story line & the characters. Would love to see this made into a movie! Funny part is I bought this book on accident, it's the BEST mistake I've ever made! Do not miss reading this!!! Now that I've been introduced to Luke Smitherd, I want more!
Move over, Stephen King.  This author is that good.  I couldn't put it down.  Just enough detail so that there weren't any holes but not so much as to bog it down.  Well done.

The premise and the execution of this story puts it, to my mind, in the category of classic sci-fi.  This truly is a terrifying book, a book I could not put down.  It's becoming more and more difficult to find the gold among the dross in books today but this book was well worth my time.  Well done!

I'm pretty "jaded" for horror and scary things....but this book was very intriguing and frightening!  I can't wait to read the Black Room.  The little excerpt at the end of Stone Man has been on my mind for days!

I am amazed at the authors ability to take a fantastical idea and make it seem plausible. I feel a connection with each character he creates and can relate to them despite them being in circumstances that are otherworldly. For the price, you'd be crazy not to read this.

I enjoyed it.  While it was a sci fi thriller, the characters were well fleshed out and the plot line was as peculiar as I have seen in a while.  Really original.  No fantastic space battles; no futuristic setting.  But very good writing style.  Really enjoyable.  It left me very curious as to the Author.  I will see what else I can find by him.
Tremendous. I was looking for something completely original and different, this nailed it spot on. Highly recommended. Great job Luke! I will be purchasing your other works immediately.

Some readers have expressed dismay about how the story ended but I, personally, love stories that end this way. The writing was very good, the story had a wonderful blend of suspense / action / emotion and it was extraordinarily well edited for being a self published ebook and only a second book from the author at that.

This was a fascinating story--the two main characters were real.  They had quite different personalities but ones we all could recognize.  And the ending was totally unpredictable--to the extent that there actually was a real end.  This is one of the books that keeps you reading late at night.

I probably should not be writing this review as I did not finish the book.  I read about 100 pages that took me a month to get through.  The plot was interesting but for some reason I found it very, very slow moving, sluggish.  I hope to pick it up some time in the future but maybe not.

This new one from Luke was enjoyable to read. If you want to read a book with a different type of story line then I believe you would like this. It certainly had me trying to guess what the Stone Man really wanted. Also if you haven't read POTD then I strongly suggest you do asap. (His first book)

I don't think I've ever read an author who used so many words and said nothing. I kept reading and reading and reading, skipping paragraphs at a time trying to find the story, but when I saw I was only 26% through the book after all that effort, I finally just put it down.

Well this is my first review ever on Amazon,  and it is my third Luke Smitherd book,  and i must say i loved every word of it.  Memorable characters,  thrilling mistery and intelligent humor,  this book is a real page turner.  On with TPOTD next…

I enjoyed the author's style, but I'm not sure I agree it's a "thriller".  In this case the "solution" was pretty obvious half way through the book and there really wasn't a meaningful "conclusion" at the end.
I honestly still think of this book even 6 months after I read it. The situation the main character is left in is a HUGE twist. I couldn't put it down, I had to keep on reading. Would recommend this.
Most of the Hands-on books I have read have been enjoyable books of fledgling or up and coming writers. This book was a step above in originality, pace of story and character development. Bravo!!!
This book was SO STUPID I only got thru about a third of it before I gave up...it was pure torture to get that far..if someone else can read the whole thing I would love to hear about it!!!
Compelling reading. Given a startling appearance of a stone statue that begins to move like a man the story continues at a gripping pace toward a sound but not fully satisfying ending
This is a book that once the story begins, there is an inertia that doesn't let you go until the end.  I'm not sure how I feel about the end, I'll let other readers decide.

ok here's my second try at this!  i dont understand some of the negative reviews at all!  i originally only got a sample of this book and promptly forgot about it.  i started it and gt sucked into the pot and promptly went back and got the book.  Andy and Paul were great as albiet unwilling 'finders' of the Stone Men's prey.  Henry, victim 2, was both inspiring and heartbreaking in his terror and courage at his fate. Victim 3,Theresa (Spoiler Alert) smothrred her own baby to save her froma fate she wasnt sure of but knew would be terrible. Who could blame her for stabbing  the solders who were coming to hand her over to such a fate? Wouldnt you? i certainly would!  SPOILER ALERT!! When Andy and Paul became frightened and paranoid thereafter and realized THEY had been 'chosen' they knew what their fate would be.  The differeces in their manner of dealing with it was inspired!  As for typos, the only thing that stood out for me was the use of 'floors' whether you were indoors or out, but was so consistent i decided perhaps the author is from an area that uses that terminolgy.  it certainly doesnt detract from his great imagination!  i sure hope there's a sequel.
There seemed to be a lot of"filler"( un- necessary )  verbiage to keep the story moving forward. I'm not sure it I will dead another story by the same author.
THE STONE MAN is a must for hard core sci-fi lovers.  The most original plot I've ever encountered; and I read a lot!  Thank you Luke Smitherd!

To the author - Wow! Thought provoking! Your story will stick with me! I agree with you that sometimes you need to let the reader fill in the gaps and actually "think" the story through. For me it all flowed. Loved your characters. I am an animal lover and enjoyed your animal portraits with all its surprising twists! Your story was refeshingly original. I was never bored. Love your frankness at the end, explaining to your readers where you are at, the importance of reviews, etc. Its great some Kindle readers get a free book, but hey, its your bread and butter. READERS take a minute as a thank you and review. Im not your editor so, as long as I can read it, a few minor errors is not going to rock my boat LOL! By the way I think whenever a writer chooses the topic of the after life, and it dosent fit with the readers idea of what that is, there will be negatives. But peeps, its a story! Right? You have gained a new fan, keep up the good work! Best of luck to you! Cheers!
Thoroughly engaging story. An intelligent, thought provoking sci-fi that is by turns heart-breakingly/horrifically/courageously human.
This was a good read. It was written in the UK so it has that England tone to it but it doesn't dampen the plot it rather enhances it.
Luke Smitherd spins a yarn that keeps one on the edge of your seat, right up to the surprise ending!  I heartily recommend this book!
Very different than most science fiction. Leaves unanswered questions. As usual the government is too secretive. Very dark in spots.
I enjoyed the book. Sometimes the story was hard to follow with the transitions from "present and past".  Will read his next book.

The book starts out dramatically as an alien life form terrorizes England. The Stone Man stops for nothing! Then the magic happens. And I'm not talking about the good magic, this is the "defies the laws of physics as we know" type magic, which usually means an author reached a dead end and whipped out this explanation to get him out. Later, things slowed down, and alien #2 hits. (None of this is a spoiler, as Mr. Smitherd drops hints like a horse drops ... you get the picture.)  I fall asleep on the plane, reading. The story telling gets more ponderous. I fall asleep on the couch, reading. The plot wanders and the author gets to pretend he is rich and successful. I fell asleep in bed, reading.Then the end hits and ... wait, that was no ending, just a story whose batteries have run out. So read the first third, put it down, and consider yourself lucky.
The story did grab me and pulled me along. Great idea for something completely different in human/alien first encounter.
I didn't want this book to end, and now I'm left with an emotion I've only ever had when finishing a Kafka masterpiece.
A good book. The ending is unconventional and unsatisfying. Other than that, it is an original and interesting story.
A suspenseful  and exciting effort. I was impressed  with the plot, loved them humor and got to the end too quickly.
Great fun.  Really was not sure of all the twists and turns, kept it interesting.  Very unusual idea, liked that.

I wasn't sure what to expect when I picked up The Stone Man and, frankly, I'm not all that sure I know what I think about it now that I've finished. Did I enjoy it? Well, yes, actually, quite a bit. The plot is intriguing, the writing good, the storytelling brisk and, contrary to a few reviews, it is the characters exposition that makes the story compelling. However, I must admit to a nagging disatisfaction at the end. Perhaps it was the rather ambiguous ending, though that usually doesn't bother me. Rather, I think I was intrigued by Paul and, especially, Brigadier Straub. There were hints that there was much hidden by that professional facade. There was a lot more to Paul, too, I think, that might have explained better explained his visceral reaction to certain events. Perhaps a sequel is in order?
Brilliantly written book. I didn't want it to end! Intriguing and different sci-fi. Well worth a read.

I just finished this book and am very impressed.  The story was very different from anything I have read before and I know that it will stick with me for a long time.  The people were very believable and they reacted to situations like I would expect an imperfect and normal person would react.  The story kept me going and I wanted to know what was going to happen next.  How would it end, why were they here, would they keep coming?  I wish I had bought the hard cover so I could pass it on to friends and family.  I will certainly tell them to read it.  One problem only that I didn't like was all the "F" words.  In my world that word isn't used so freely.  Call me old fashioned.  Other than that I loved the book.
Tedious writing style. Interesting and original story though. Too much dialog for my reading taste.

I was completely absorbed by the mystery of the Stone Man. The book is an interesting mixture of mystery and horror story. Some, but not all, of the mystery is solved by the end. I generally read hard Science Fiction, with excursions into dystopian fiction and fantasy;..but this caught my attention and kept it. I actually want to read more by this author now, which is the highest compliment I can pay. I liked his storytelling style. I wouldn't say it is my new favorite book. But I liked it a lot and thought the idea was so interesting....and scary. There were a lot of typos in the edit that I purchased. I don't know if there is a version that has been edited since, but that was a bit bothersome.
And now that I've left my review I waste no more time searching for more of this author s work!
Honest to goodness science fiction. Well written, no magic, just a really good sci fi story.

At least the cover doesn't advertise this story as an 'action' thriller, since the action is not exactly fast & furious. I am very eager to suspend my disbelief, but in this case, it was extremely difficult.  Perhaps if this happened in real life, I would be one of the casualties because I wouldn't be able to believe my eyes! I read the whole story and appreciated the relationship between the two main characters' odd friendship. The depiction of their personalities was probably the most interesting and moving aspect to me. After it all, I still am not really able to put all the pieces together as a whole story. For some, that may be the attraction of this novel.

What a terrific read!  You are "there" as events unfold and, along with newsmonger Andy, the story's narrator, you witness the terror and confusion of the population from the Stone Man's firsts appearance.  You are "with" Andy as he comes to understand that he has some strange connection with the Stone Man.  Could this be the story of his career, or the end of his life?  You also have an insider's view of the decisions the military makes in its efforts to deal with the alien menace, and how the main characters become part of the military's efforts.  This adds an element of realism that is lacking in other sci fi novels.  Highly recommended.
really enjoyed all the twists in the plot and REALLY did not see the way it ended coming.

I was intrigued by the description of the story. This is the first "science fiction" novel I've read in a while. The part I liked was the deep personal and authentic POV of the main character - the book focuses mostly on the human impact of the Stone Man and less on tech and action. The British tone of voice is also fun to read. The main character is a writer and he tends ramble on and on at times - I felt like I was wading through during these parts. The end was intriguing but ultimately a bit unsatisfying. The alternative ending (look for it) felt better to me. Don't get me wrong, I was drawn back to the book every time I put it down.

What a fantastic book. "A Science Fiction Thriller Novel" describes it perfectly—The Stone Man (and the science fiction implications thereof) play second fiddle to the main characters and their humanity... their characterization. Smitherd's writing here is superb—I'm typically not a fan of first-person narrative, but here it really, really works. You experience the characters, rather than being given glimpses into the insides of their skulls. I kind of guessed some of the events towards the end of the book, but again, those events are merely the medium through which Andy and co. are fleshed out.

I enjoyed this book. It is unique and absorbing. I love good science fiction, especially the kind that doesn't weave in scores of weird creatures or alien made up words. Having something strange and otherworldly happen in the middle of a normal earthlings normal life makes it fascinating to me. You can imagine being there. The author went overboard in his lengthy mental arguments and conversations lasted longer than they needed to. I skipped some of those parts. But the seeds of the arguments and conversations were strong. A very good story!

To be fair, I think this book started out great, it was fast paced and unpredictable, it's characters built with purpose. but like many novels which started out blazingly, it began to slow down, then stagger; eventually stalling it's engine in mid-air, and spiraling down towards disaster. It's really a good book, but only a 4 star, but that's just my singular opinion. There are many who think it deserves to be 5 stars, then again some who just gave it 2. That's why they make both Vanilla and Chocolate Ice Cream.

I am pretty stingy with stars so three is pretty good. Very good early effort, great imagination and pretty well written. A little ponderous and wordy in places but better than sparse and all dialogue like many new writers. Story is original and keeps you reading. Am going to be looking for more books by him, great potential. Read now so you can say you read his books when...definitely worth the price! Just started his Black Room series, very engaging, well done showing continued maturity as a writer.

I hate to give negative reviews, but must make an exception here.  The alien artifact materializes out of nowhere but can only walk in straight lines; crashing through building after building.  It can't access Google maps, but seems to know about human DNA sequencing.  Oh, and rather than taking a cheek scraping or a bit of spinal fluid, it takes a whole piece of the spine.  This was just silly and not worth the evening.  Maybe with professional editing the story could have been developed.

I really enjoyed this book. I bought it because the premise was quirky....difficult to find a new slant on "sci-fi" sometimes. The writer's style takes a little getting used to, but it's engaging nevertheless. I will look for his other novels...Also, I am not used to writing reviews really but the author pleads for feedback in his postscript, which I find kinda funny. I think I would feel the same. Anyway, I read loads of novels...this one was really worth reading.

Don't push too hard on reasonable possibility here.  This variation on Body Snatchers lacks depth for the protagonist while portraying the military as woodenly opaque.  The storyline is basically an analysis of the value of one versus the value of many.  But we find no proposed conclusion. At the ending we find the invaders made to look both powerful and stupid at the same time, while humans can do nothing more than resolve to continue an endless game of fox & hounds.

Found this title through the Amazon Lending Library. The premise looked interesting, so I gave it a shot. Well written and suspenseful, it hooked me in from the very beginning. I like how the author switches narratives throughout the story, going from first person accounts of what happened to third person towards the end. It had me guessing how it would turn out, and I admit the solution wasn't what I was expecting, which is why I liked this book...A LOT!

But geez - this guy loves fluff...  It's like back in school we all kept adding irrelevant stuff and changed fonts, spacing to hit the required number of pages.  The first half of the book is almost impossible to read - there is no more than 10% there of content that actually advances the plot.  As it builds - closer to the end - relevant content slowly rises to almost full pages...

A wonderful and amazingly original book! It's always such a pleasure to discover a new writer on Amazon. This book was not like any other I have ever read. The plotline is intriguing, the characters are likable, and the action is non-stop. What makes this sci-fi novel stand out to me are the questions the writer poses about our responsibilities to other people, and what drives a person to sacrifice himself for the good of his fellow human beings?

Well i am not a fan of first person narratives, as i ind them overly self indulgent.  That being said, i got past my hangup and enjoyed the book. Although some sort of answers would have been nice and Hollywood, i think the ambiguity as to the why is a much better option, as it reflects the reality of what would probably happen. Anyhow it was worth the read, a bit tedious in the maudlin treatment of the protagonist but not without its charm

Very good book, Luke, a very good read; I couldn't quite put it down.  I'm a sci-fi reader from way back, and I like this story and your treatment of it.  I thought the 'stream of consciousness' style would be annoying, but it turned out it was anything but.  Very good character development, and the only thing I anticipated was your final solution!  Keep writing!  I started your excerpt of 'The Black Room', and I like it already.  Thanks

I really did not expect to like this as much as I did. A free book by an unknown author, filler for sure. Nope. Good story, well written. Kept me involved and interested throughout. My only negative is that, about 40% into the book, I was very ready to never read the word "whilst" again and by the end it was like nails on a chalk board. I f that's the only issue, I say well done. I will be following this author in the future.

Totally enjoyed it. Smitherd has a knack for developing characters that are so honest they keep the story anchored with a feeling of reality, which makes this a very enjoyable read. I'm always on the hunt for an authentic new voice, and this author is one I will read again. Well plotted and paced, an easy, fluent style and memorable, beautifully drawn characters make this a book I recommend to anyone who loves speculative fiction.

Pretty good, and my standards are high! I read this in two sittings. The mystery of the Stone Man is compelling. It was hard to imagine how Smitherd would pull off a satisfying ending, but he did. (Then he had to go and undercut it by providing an "alternative" ending at the back of the book, but oh well.) I would count this money well spent even if I had spent money for it, instead of getting it on Kindle Unlimited.

A fresh an exciting voice in science fiction, Luke Smitherd has created a stunning story that is both fantastic and all-too-believable.  With chillingly realistic perspectives, the story of two men caught in life changing events beyond their control is scary, fascinating and honest.  There is no pretense in these characters, (or this story): no maudlin appeals to 'man kinds better nature'; no false heroics.  When faced with the simplest and most frightening events in their lives, these characters react exactly as you and I would---with fear, humor, desperation and indecisiveness.  It is exactly this honesty in writing that makes this story so appealling.  I couldn't put the damn thing down.  Bravo.

The main theme of the story a Stone Man that came out from nowhere in the middle of the UK and goes stomping off in a straight line across the country is pretty weird.  Not like Godzilla terrorizing the locals, the motives of the Stone Man are absolutely mysterious.  Somehow the mystery never gets resolved.  I like the writing style though long-winded story telling, some chapters are too long and some are too short.  Unfortunately the author just cut it abruptly, then begged the reader to give it a star rating, with a slice of his book to be, and some sloppy alternative ending draft.  If he wants to get a higher star rating, he should finish the story properly.  Looks like his stuff is kind of surreal.

I enjoyed this book.  While the premise of the Stone Man was intriguing, what was more interesting to me was the study of the human and societal reactions to such inexplicable and terrifying events.  I do understand how some might find the ending unsatisfying, but I felt it was emotionally appropriate and allows the reader the possibility to do some self-reflection.  And leaves open the possibility of a sequel.

Well-drawn characters and a good plot device make this one a winner. One of the things that I found most interesting was the first person narrative that shows a character developing self-awareness in a way that would not have happened were it not for the Stone Man. For readers who like action and high tech on every page this might seem to slow down the story but, from another perspective, it is the story.
Very engaging characters, I really enjoyed the story!

Great read. Very surprised at the length and substance of this book. liked his characters, very well drawn and believable,  Straub in particular. I am an avid Sci-Fi reader on kindle well over a hundred in the last couple of years and this is right up there in the top 3 of unknown mainstream authors. Managed to keep me hooked right to the end. Will go directly to see what else he has written.

This author has a knack for spinning out a story. Not direct to the point, not follow of consciousness. It's more Shakespearean perhaps, of course in no scholar, I just remember a few bits of Shakespeare that might have read similarly, where the protagonist takes the lead in telling their story. Quite a different style than I'm used to. But still thoroughly engaging. A rather pleasant read.

This was the first book I've read by Luke Smitherd, and I immediately followed it up with a couple others.  He is an author that I will read all that he writes.  Great, original writing, and no hesitance to be bold.  And I loved the ending as presented, Luke -- I think you went the right direction in deciding not to use the alternative ending.  Fun, fun, fun

Really well written SF.  Totally different and novel concept.  Spellbinding compelling narrative, great story concept, wonderful character development, and kept me on the edge the entire book. And to top it all off, he is a really funny guy who understands human nature.  I am now looking for my next Smitherd book.  He is going on my list of favorite authors.
I almost put the book down after the first 20 pages. I am glad I did not. The plot develops slowly but turns and twists ends in a completely unexpected way.

For all it's worth, this gets three stars because I read it 5 or 6 months ago and can clearly remember it.  It is distinct in my mind vs. other books that merge into the masses of reading I've done.  But it's distinctive partly because reading it was so off-putting.  The Brit slang, the characters, the narrative pace and tone, the story itself were difficult to like while I was reading.  The ending was of a piece with the book.  Would I read another book by Smitherd?  Maybe. I'd definitely read a sample.
Great book for science fiction and psychology lovers. Similar to an Asimov book in depth of character development and thought provoking plot.
A nice job of putting a new twist on the boogeyman.

My first book by this author, and enjoyed it immensely. The ending came out of left field for me, I had no idea how he was going to stop TSM from coming back again and again. A good ending for a sequel perhaps??? :-)
Ha, this was my pleasure book on my summer vacation this year. It was a lot of fun, I liked the characters, and we don't want any Stone Men around here thank you!
A great Science Fiction story with great writing!!!! Keep it coming Luke :)
Great story line, I would love to see a movie about this concept.  The story moved along well and kept me wondering what was going to happen.  I for one thought it was a very good book

Very frightening!  Loved it.  I could totally imagine how scary it would be for a figure like the Stone Man to appear out of nowhere.  Poor Andy and mostly poor Paul.  Andy was very shallow, but still, no one would have guessed that those Caementum would just keep coming back.  I wish there would be a sequel cause I can't imagine how Paul will survive the driving in a circle much longer.  And England just kept on sacrificing people to it, when any one should be able to figure out that once they get what they want, they'll just keep dividing and keep on coming.  I'm in the US and I kept thinking that one or two would show up there.  Just imagine if one left England, went into the sea, and walked all the way across the ocean to America.  When it came on shore, total panic.  If only it could be led into the Mariana Trench, how would it get out of there?  The scenarios are endless.  Thanks, Mr. Smitherd, this kept me entertained for a few hours.
An intriguing read. It did not finish as expected either, so a good twist. One of the better free books and I would read another by this author.

I have read and enjoyed science fiction all my life - the good and the not so good. Luke Smitherd has authored an exceptional work here in The Stone Man. This holds up well against the giants in Sci-Fi like Bradbury or Asimov. The story is intriguing in itself but I really like the way Smitherd handles the human side (slight pun off the story line) of the protagonist. He is a brave hero and a cowering scoundrel - sometimes in virtually the same moment. Most of all he reacts to fantastic circumstances with real human thoughts and emotions. There are also points in the story that he waxes philosophical amidst his wonderful / horrible journey that caused me to pause - like Neo atop the WTC - and just go “Whoa!” Many other reviewers have provided a synopsis of the story so I won’t bother with that - only to say that the setting and descriptions of the actions and interactions make for a very realistic and believable tale. There were times I found my heart racing and my body tensed in anticipation of the next page, as well as times that I read much later into the night (and morning) than I planned - because I couldn’t stop. This was the first book of Smitherd’s that I have read but it won’t be the last – well done mate!
A quirky concept, but it works surprisingly well. I like the writing style. Loved that little scenario with Shaun and the wife ;-)

I've been a fan of British sci-fi all my life - H.G.Wells, John Wyndham etc so this book piqued my interest. A fascinating read, certainly kept my interest. Characters well drawn. I never quite knew where it was going next so I cannot say it was predictable in any way. If you like thoughtful sci-fi stories based on Earth in current times, you can't go too far wrong with this. Not a book for those that prefer Space Operas or action packed sagas as this book moves at a rather leisurely pace - one could say walking pace.

Original Idea and Syfi I Love to Read! I didn't count the number of the pronoun I in this book because the storyline and characters kept me rapt. I will read more of Smithred's writing to see what other original syfi ideas he can give birth to.

Luke Smitherd is going to be a force in the fiction world, where he gets his ideas from. I really enjoyed this as it was my first book of his I read. I have read others of his and I scratch my head and simply can not believe the bizarre and wonderful ideas of his. Really good read.

Loved this book! I was really struck by the originality of the story - many of the books I have read recently have followed fairly predictable storylines but this one really stood out from the crowd. I loved how the story unfolded and was often surprised by the twists and turns. I liked the rich detail given to the main characters' thoughts, opinions and actions - I really felt I knew them well and cared what happened to them. A great read!
The story drags a bit here and there but all in all a solid entertaining book.  I'll be reading more by this author.

I really enjoy a science fiction thriller with ominous (and unexpected) undertones of fear, and The Stone Man fits that bill. The eBook was hard to put down (so to speak) as the characters and situations were well-crafted and seemed realistic. The uncertainty of the Stone Men's actions serve as a good plot vehicle and antagonist all in one. I plan to search out Luke Smitherd's other books as well.

I thought the premise of this story was great and would be entertaining...until I started reading it. I struggled in giving it a one or two rating because although I did finish it there were many sentences, paragraphs and pages I skipped. The constant babbling and carrying on of the same subject without getting any deeper into the storyline was maddening. Giving two stars just because I didn't stop reading completely as I was  hoping the story would get better. The ending didn't improve and was a little strange.
Although the book does not move rapidly, it kept my interest and I enjoyed it. The only disturbing element is the frequent use of expletives. I intend to read more of Smitherd's work.
This is the first book by Luke Smitherd which I have read.  I enjoyed it very much.  I will definitely be reading more of his books!

After reading The Rho Agenda, Silo Saga, and the Atlantean Trilogy, on top of numerous other sci-fi books as I love the genre, this book just seemed very flat. I feel like there was no resolution. It left me wanting much much more in the end.
Great mystery Sci-Fi, loved the characters and the author's "voice". I've now purchased his entire works and am starting through them. Highest review ever!

I read a bit of both the main stream writers and the smaller Indy writers. Take note. This writer is on his way up. Well written story that kept me up late just to find out the next twist. Will definitely be reading more of this author's work. Well done.
I enjoyed "The Stone Man' at each step of the way.  The characters keep the reader interested and the ending really works.
It was a unique story and kept me interested all the way through.  Not an amazing book, but a solid read.
Not the worst. Lots of whining from one pompous, unlikeable, main character. Not a satisfying ending, (neither one) to the book.
this was well written, and a really good idea. i enjoyed how the author kept to the information that we would get in the real world.
GREAT book! I loved reading it. Didn't want it to end; it was just like a great meal or dessert---delicious! I can't wait to read Smitherd's other books.

A man shaped being or object looking like it is made of stone suddenly appears in London. It starts walking in a straight line through and over the city landscape creating havoc and destruction. "The stone man" seems to be unstoppable. The hero of the story is the narrator and writes in a conversational way which is amusing and easy to read. I found this one hard to stop reading.

It took me a while to get into it.  Then an easy read.  A few moments of some excitement but moves along without any speed.  Overall an enjoyable reading experience.  The ending was extremely unsatisfying.  The alternative ending offered slightly better.  I'd give it three stars but gave 4 due to the novel idea.

With the exceptional reviews, I decided to use the Amazon book exchange to read this novel. While the plot seemed interesting, the character development was minimal. I can't recommend this, for those reasons.
A really well paced and entertaining read. Highly recommended. Keeps you gripped to the very end. Easily worth 5 stars.

Bottom line, I really enjoyed reading this.  I usually read Stephen King and that type of story, and I thought it kept my interest just as well.  I'm not a writing critic by any stretch, I just read what I like and if it bores me I don't finish it.  I was interested till the end.  I really liked the characters and the way they interacted as well.  I didn't feel much of the "thriller" in it, but that didn't matter at all, I guess you could kind of feel the fear the characters were feeling.  I also found myself laughing quite a few times during some of the interactions between Andy and Paul.  Luke does a really good job telling the story from the main character's point of view, and you get a really clear visual of what you are reading, which for my attention span is very important.  I'm well into another book by Luke and enjoying that one as well.  Looking forward to more by him.
Boring. Not much of a "thriller". Took me a while to finish because it just did not seem to build any excitement.

I download this book immediately after finishing another one of this author's books, The Black Room.  I thoroughly enjoyed both these books, and will be reading more from this author.  His stories are unique and intriguing, and The Stone Man was a thrilling read.  I will continue to read this author's books.  Luke Smitherd has a talent for writing, and he's going places!
This was something different for me as I normally read mysteries and horror.  This was a nice change.  I enjoyed it and am currently reading another book by this author.
Not up to Lee Childs or John Sandford, but still I found myself looking forward to picking up and reading more when I didn't have it in my hands.

This was a page Turner for me !!!!  I like reading different types of books this is one for sure in a good way. I had to keep reading to see what was going to happen and if it could be stopped.  There is grammar errors and miss spelling but you can still go with the story and it keep me turning the pages!!!!!
I don't usually submit a review, however, The Stone Man was not only an original  and suspenseful science fiction story, it was also quite suspenseful.
A very different sort of SF novel and very reminiscent of the old Twilight Zone or Outer Limits thrillers. Left me with my own theories...

This author is very inventive and knows how to resolve just enough of the mystery to satisfy while leaving a bit unrevealed, so one can continue to ponder the book even after finishing it.  Loved the ending.  This author has real promise!
I was glued to this book until I finished.  Just could not get out of it until I knew what happened.

This book is based on an interesting concept and I enjoyed the humor, suspense, and good writing. Very few spelling errors/misused words, and the writing was clear and engaging. I thought Paul's character was under-developed and switching to his POV at the end was a little jarring, and Andy's diagnosis of Asperger's seemed unrealistic and unnecessary. Given the unlikely nature of the precipitating event, the reactions of all involved seem very believable. Kudos to Mr. Smitherd for doing his research well! Bottom line, I recommend this book, I just don't think it's exceptional or something I will want to read again and again.
Kept me fully engaged from first to last. Hoped for a more definitive ending, but no joy, maybe next time. I will read more of Mr. Smitherd's work.

Great writing style, suspense that keeps you interested in this sci-fi novel.  Ending was a little bit of a let down, but then it all seemed to make sense when you turn it over in your mind.  Will most likely read more by this author.

Ponderous action follows a deeply worn path to a foregone conclusion with very little relief. Perhaps it's some one else's cup of tea. I stuck it out to the end but this was not a meal eaten with relish and certainly no spice added in the "cook" pot. Very similar to bland oatmeal..
Great story and characters. Overuse of profanity for me it detracted from otherwise a good book. Would like to see sequel

I gave 4 stars because I enjoyed the sense of suspence, however, didn't like either endings. Should have had the government finding a way to communicate w/alien being & Paul being the only one able to unravel why they have come. Something like that anyway. Just felt let down at the end, no clearcut ending.
The book was interesting enough that I finished it but not a page turner. It seemed to have lulls in the story line.
Main characters were credible and their thought processes understandable  I would have liked a more satisfactory conclusion and possible followups.
The Stone Man is an excellent sci-fi, I enjoyed it throughout, felt the ending was unexpected. I hope to read more from Mr. Smitherd soon.
Enjoyable read!! I was pleasantly surprised, well worth your time, give it a try! I hope there is more to come....
Great story. Held my interest all the way through. Ending a bit weak but worked. I hope Luke Smithered keeps writing.
The characterizations were solid and the writing tight . Finally a great "self published" or similar work! Very Highly recommended

I was intrigued by the concept; and I enjoyed the story.  I would have liked to know a bit more about those who sent The Stone Man, perhaps something a bit more philosophical; but it was an entertaining read.
Very Innovative story; but the author took too many words to tell it. In addition, the ending left me hanging but not enough to be looking forward to a sequel.
Interesting premise. Enjoyed the  characters. A page turner, hard to put down. Will purchase more from this author. Great sci ti.

I've been buying Kindle books for.only a year or so. I tend to buy the less expensive choices, hoping to find that elusive "diamond in the rough" . I've met with some success, but a lot of disappointment. Don't get me wrong. Being able to read a novel for 99¢ is wonderful. Still, there are some less than stellar entries. Stone Man is one of the most precisely written novels I've read in a while.I won't say it was Foundation worthy, or even Lucifers Hammer, but it sure was neat. Written well enough that I really only wanted what he gave. In other words, I don't feel rippled off. Great story. Great characters. Good read. I'll be following Mr Smitherd's work. Quite enjoyable.
Still reading it, but I love the angle. I can't give away much, because I am still in the midst of the read, but what has happened so far, and especially the perspective, is just plain fun!

quick and simple I enjoyed the book a lot. didnt want to put it down a few times. I was a little less thrilled with the ending. I understand the hanging end but some resolution in the end is better for me in a book unless your planning a 2 or 3 part series. I liked the original ending better although I would have liked to see the devices have actually been tried to stop the stone man and a little technical info on why they may have worked. but I enjoyed the book bottom line

Luke Smitherd is a writer to watch, and his second novel The Stone Man is a great read. The story which kept me engaged throughout, and the characters are believable. I will definitely read more of his books.
Loved the story.  I would highly recommend this book to any type of reader, not just for science fiction readers

I'm not going to give away details of the story because that's not what a review is. A review is essentially your own personal thoughts and feelings of the story. So I will start by saying it was a bit slow getting to the twists and turns but once it got there it never let up. I really liked the authors style of writing and I will definitely be looking forward to more by him.

When I first read what this book was about, I thought it might turn out to be pretty silly; I was wrong. It starts a tad slow, but the pace speeds up quickly. Character developement is quite good and believable. Although the premise of the story sounds absurd, I was completely drawn into it! Definately a good read

This book kept me interested and looking forward to the next page throughout the entire story. It was well written, well organized, and well presented. Kudos to the author.  For sure, i will follow his writing.  Enjoyed all of it.  EKM
Wow! Great book by an author I'd not previously read. I will definitely read more of this fellow's work. He's going places!

I liked this book, I gave it a solid five stars a few days after reading it. If I would have rated straight away I might have given something less but after reading an entirely different book I realized I was still thinking about this book. I found for me it was a metaphor for death. These terrifying impressive stone things landing and then slowly marching across the landscape, taking out and impervious to anything in their path they were just downright creepy. All the best scientific minds working round the clock to try and stop it, to try and understand it with with all their gadgets all to no avail. Some people are driven mad by it, some are rendered helpless by it, hiding away behind closed curtains. Some face it with dignity and want to face it with boots on and a lets get on with it courage. Others want to make deals with it want to try and bargain for more time. I'm sure I have it all wrong but that's what I took from it. A good solid story and I liked the ending.
Love this creative author and am reading all his stuff. I have no more to say- must "keep reading"... gp

Just finished the Stone Man and thoroughly enjoyed it. It had an science fiction aspect to it but was so much more than that. The characters were well developed and very interesting particularly in their introspective slant on both events and themselves. Congratulations and a well done to the author. I definitely plan to read more of his work. I definitely recommend him and his work to you.
I liked Luke Smitherd's writing style and I liked the story but the ending left a lot to be desired.  I was also somewhat put off my Smitherd's begging for people to read his books.

I thonk the characters and story are quite compelling from the start.  The story grows steadily and has enough surprises and twists to keep the plot moving ... and the characters maturing ... until the end.  Well done.
Don't usually go for sci  but this was a great read. Kept my interest throughout. I definitely recommend. A thriller.

The Stone Man is one of the best, and most original, science fiction thrillers I've read in a long time.  The intriguing story starts with the appearance of the Stone Man and keeps the reader engaged to the very end.  Without giving too much away, I will say that I personally love the fact that not all questions are tidily answered.  Often, authors over-explain things that are best left to the reader's imagination. I will definitely read more by Luke Smitherd and look forward to seeing what else he'll come up with.  In summary, this is a great read that I definitely recommend to fans of thrillers and sci-fi alike.

I wasn't sure if this was my kind of story at first, but once I got into it, it was thoroughly engaging. The subject matter was different, a little bizarre, which kept my interest going. But it was the characters I enjoyed the most; no "good guy" or "bad guy" ( at least among the humans), but each character a mix of good, bad, and indifferent, just like any person you'd meet on the street. I found the writing to be fresh and well-done. Definitely an author I will read again!

After stopping and starting this book – mainly because it failed to keep my interest – I had to quit reading at the 53% mark on my Kindle.  You have the same thing going on page click after page click without much excitement or understanding of why the events of the book were happening.  After reading just over half of the book, I gave up and deleted it.  About the only thing “science fiction” about this is an unexplained character that causes mayhem and destruction – I would give this one a pass.

The Stone Man is a well presented story with much mystery and suspense.  The characters are very well done.  It would be great for Mr. Smitherd to enlighten us as to the where the stone man came from.

The writing is great, the dialog and story are believable (humanity's parts anyway - within the context of the strangeness being portrayed). The ending was the perfect way to leave the story. I like the plodding, inescapable inevitability that the Stone Man represents - sort of like the Michael Meyers character in the original Halloween. A veritable energizer bunny as the antagonist.

The idea of a stone man wa svery unique.  Some of the things that took a while to come out in the story were obvious to me, but made sense from the perspective of the characters.  And the government response was exactly hwat I would expect (and what they would hide/smooth over).

I am a big fan of science fiction genre and have gone through many authors and my all time favorite being Scott Sigler but this guy has tried to make a decent attempt and a very commendable effort. Its a great read for the weekend and will keep you hooked. it feels a little slow at start but overtime the characters start to grow on you and you want to continue till the last line.

I really liked the way this story was narrated, it felt as if the characters were really talking to me and not just typical dialogue. The story was intense, but I have to agree with others that I was surprised at so few attempts to try other things weren't considered, before throwing lambs to the slaughter, so to speak. I mean what would have happened if Andy had stayed in New York? But all in all it was a good read, with interesting and likeable characters!
Great story, kept me interested to the very end. Quite original and the end is awesome. Will recommend to my sci-fi reading group.
Stone Man is an exciting read. A different kind of thriller. I couldn't put it down. Finished it at 3:00 in the morning.

The book was okay, I liked it. But I found myself enjoying the authors comments in the back of the book more than the story itself. The author seems to be a really nice man, with a great view of the world. It's just the story I found wanting...it needed a little more to it, some more action, side trails, more development on the characters - and maybe a few more characters with added excitement to the story to make it more interesting. It was worth the read, but I just couldn't really get into the story like some others. However, you're definitely unique - and I like that very much Luke Smitherd.  I am interested in your style and story lines, but it may take too much out of me if the story takes a long time to be up and running.  Like I tell my drummer husband (who is phenomenal btw), "Do your drum solos like a good story - start big and hook 'em quick and then let them enjoy the ride."

I've given this book three stars because I enjoyed the premise of a mysterious stone statue appearing in a busy city centre and proceeding to cause havoc for an unknown reason. I can recommend it as a gripping read with a well managed plot and complex, believable characters.  On the down side, it started off at a good pace, but slowed about half way through due to pages and pages of introspective thoughts of the narrator. It felt like the story had been padded out to bump up the word count, which put me off awarding four stars.

I really enjoyed this book. Ms Smitherd's style of writing flows with the inner working of the lead characters.  I found myself wondering how he could come up with these ideas. He's a pretty wordy guy but uses those words to take the reader deep into the souls, emotions and thoughts of the characters. I would highly recommend this book and have already purchased another of his book. Keep em' coming,
It started off quickly. A real page turner. I lost a few nights sleep in anticipation. A nice read. Makes me want to read more of his books.

This was one of my recommendations on Amazon, and probably would not have read it had it not been free on Prime because some reviews where shoddy. However, Luke Smitherd is now my new favorite author. This is a quick paced, dark, action packed thriller. It has been a long time since I stayed up until 2am to finish a book! I loved it and would highly recommend to any scifi fans! I will be reading another one of Smitherd's next for sure. :-)

As someone who is always looking for something new (tired of the same characters, plots, themes) I found this book refreshing. The author does a good job of creating a believable setting and, although it takes a while, the reader gets to know the main characters fairly well by the end. The use of parentheses was a bit distracting at times, but I got used to it. This book was well written, and I am betting that the author's future works will be (are) even better. I will definitely read more by this author.

First time writing a review. This book got me good. How good? I immediately 'went back and purchased another' good. Likeable characters, believable yarn from a sci-fi perspective. Still thinking about it two days later.Well done! Looking forward to more.

The Stone Man moves thru steel doors, crumbles cement walls, kills all who get in its way...Security forces attempt to stop this alien, when that fails, they try to understand it.  The characters are interesting and will pull you into the story and keep you on edge. Hold your breath and hope that the Stone Man isn't moving in on you.  Great Heinlein-type writing.  This author is making his mark.  Grab his next story, but watch out for a shadowy figure emerging right behind you.

An exciting thriller about mysteriously menacing figures. The protagonist for 3/4 of the movies likeable and realistic. There's a necessary shift in the protagonist department, but no morality that. Sci-fi horror describes this perfectly. Read it alone at night, and you'll check the locks and alarm twice before going to sleep!

I thought this was the best Sci-Fi book that I have ever read.  It was sooooooo psycho!  I loved the ending too - not the alternate one included in the author's notes at the end.  This author has some twisted horrible scenarios to share with the world and I cannot wait for his next book.
Not only did I enjoy this book but I've purchased three other books I'll be diving in to soon. Luke, keep up the great work. Well keep track on Facebook too see what's next. Cheers
An easy to read page-Turner. Good plot development; intriguing characters. Rarely would I like to see a sequel written; this is one of those times.

The book reminds me a little of the old school spooky late night TV shows when I was a kid growing up. But with all the modern twists you would expect for this day and age. I was sucked into the characters and the emotions of the story and had a hard time putting it down. I did have a hard time at first with the English terms and phrases that we don't use here in U.S. but eventually found this interesting rather than frustrating. I really wanted to give the book a full 5 stars, but couldn't due to typos. Not a serious problem, but enough you have to read around them here an there. The end left me wanting more, but the more I thought about it, the more I think the ending was what worked best. I highly recommend reading The Stone Man.

Really unique story.  The writing was great, and the ending was unexpected.  The ending was also like something you would see on an old Twilight Zone episode or something.  It isn't the doom you are expecting, but it certainly doesn't seem like anything to be happy about, either.
This was a great story, I thoroughly enjoyed. I especially liked the descriptive thoughts of the main characters as the story progresses. I will definitely be reading more books by this author.
So many stories I read are much the same, but this one was so different and wonderful.  I was surprised when I realized this book had new ideas.
Sad, engaging, interesting and scary. Very well told story. Not your usual alien encounter sci fi. Certainly worth the read.

A cracking read from start to finish, "The Stone Man" is a wonderful, terrifying science-fiction yarn that can best be described as "The Ruum" meets Iain Banks. Captures the spirit of the original "Twilight Zone" episodes - stripped down, elegant, fascinating, and a little scary. More please.

A very compelling and captivating story. Excellent use of suspense. My only critiques would be that it needs more polish in editing and proofreading. I will be reading more of the author's books if they are of the same caliber.

My first read of this author; it certainly kept me interested ... wondering what the hell is going to happen! I remained intrued all the way through building up to the ending, and then WHAM! It finished.  I thought "What he heck?"  re-read the last Chapter and thought: "Yep, that was good. Highly recommended; have purchased his next one and look forward to it.

Enjoyed this book immensely. It was a great complete story with very believable characters due to their very human flaws. I read trough it in just a day or so because it kept me hooked throughout. I really liked the authors dialogue and style. Looking forward to trying out some of his other works.
Engrossing read. A novel of mysterious dread. I was frustrated by the ending, and hope the author has a sequel planned.

This story is exceptionally readable (even with the occasional typo), and contains some of the most powerful writing I've ever read.  Without giving away the story, I believe the chapter I call "The Death of Henry" is right up there with "Night" by Elie Wiesel.  It was heartbreaking, soul-wrenching stuff - I'm getting teary-eyed just thinking about it.  If for no other reason, this chapter is worth the price of admission.  The fact that the rest of the book is excellent is frosting on the cake.

First of all, the concept in this book is most interesting, and what kept me reading - to find out what it was all about.  Took a bit longer than I would have liked to get there, but I did.  and it was worth it.
I'm a huge science fiction fan and I loved this book.  It has a very original premise and is well written.

This is not my typical book, but I liked it quite a  bit. The story is unusual, and I couldn't tell where it was going. It is not an action book, nor does it contain a lot of dialogue. The pace is quick, nonetheless. The main character was very "normal" - meaning he had faults and made mistakes I could see myself making. The language is a bit strong in places. It didn't bother me, but put some folks off.
Smitherd did a great job of weaving an entirely believable tale about something inherently far-fetched - my favorite kind of Sci Fi! Great job!

Thanks for writing such an original story. I had no idea where this story would end up after it started and that was refreshing. Afterwards I just wanted more! I felt like the story had just begun! Where'd the damnable things come from? What do they really want, etc. Can't wait for a sequel...hint hint. I haven't checked if there is one yet but I will!

I seldom give a whole-hearted five star rating and when I do it is after a lot of debate with myself. I didn't have that problem with this. It was a unique storyline with believable characterization. Logical conclusion. I expected it.
This book is great. The character development was outstanding.  You really understand what makes the main characters tick.  I will definitely read another work by Mr. Smitherd.
I really enjoyed this book. I found myself thinking about it all during the day and was eager to get back home so I could continue reading at night!
My first time reading this author and I will read more! On to the Black Room books. I look forward to reading more of Mr. Smitherd's wild imagination.
I loved it, with a twist of an ending you don't see coming...  I will definitely read more of him!
Well thought out story. Usually more of a HARD sci-fi reader, but pleasantly surprised. Give it a read, you will enjoy
