A FaceBook friend posted a great review of your book The Physics of the Dead telling everyone to check it out. I recognized your name because I had just gotten The Stone Man so I decided to read it. I was drawn in to the story immediately. I had to take a break and get tissues before continuing to read about Henry. You did an excellent job making me feel for these guys that were put in a difficult position. They didn't come off as saints or total jerks. And I liked the ending. Just bought The Man on Table Ten. Can't wait to read it.

An intriguing concept, very well written, with insightful characterization. This book lead me to read more of the authors work and I was not disappointed - I would recommend the book to any reader wanting a of well written mystery/thriller with exploration of the human psyche.
A page clicker to be sure......  Enjoyed the less than perfect characters in a less than perfect world, doing what needed to be done. Would definitely recommend

The book kept me hooked the whole way through... even though it was rather predictable.  However, the ending seemed forced, as if there was a deadline and it was just... time to tie it all together.  The alternate ending wasn't any better.  The sales pitch that was 10% of the text, begging for reviews and also reads of the other books from this author totally ruined it.  But I can't go less than 4 stars because of how good it was up until that point.
Á terrific story with interesting characters. A bit over descriptive in just a few passages. Almost all typos are fixedfrom earlier reviews. Nice bonus material at the end, too.
Clever and fresh! I enjoyed this book immensely and found it hard to put down. I still enjoy thinking about the story line. Definitely recommended!

This book starts out with rather stark writing and seemingly simple action then gets richer in complexity and writing as the characters learn more about the dire circumstances they are in.  By the end I found that I was debating the various moral dilemmas presented in my own mind.  I will read another of Luke Smitherd's stories.

The typos in the kindle edition were just awful; way to many.  And at times I thought the author went a bit long in spots.  But even with those criticisms, I felt it was a strong story and well worth the read.
A great read that moves along very well.  A slight let-down at the end but just a minor point.  A sequel would be welcomed.

I like this book.  Interest plot, but the ending made me think a second book is in the making.  The perspective of how the military set priorities and runs operations was very well developed and probably fits the philosophy of the governments in England, America, and Europe.
I'll keep this short... great book! (I would NOT want one of these stone dudes heading my way. Holy God!)

Overall a very good read. Loved the English flavor, and the author pulled off the sheer otherworldliness of the stone man quite well. Some of the logistical details seemed a bit of a stretch - understood, we're talking about science fiction - but at times there was a sense of difficulty in not suspending disbelief at the situation, but rather at believing that the characters could "keep up" with the events around them. However, all in all very good stuff!
Great fast read. I could use a sequel though, since the ending leaves you hanging. If you like sci-fi you should enjoy.

What makes any suspense or horror tale truly thrilling is the unknown. The author has created a real page turner as we endeavor to learn who is the stone man, his purpose, and whether there can be any hope. More than just trying to find answers to the question "why?" this story takes us into the minds of the two main characters where we get to hear the inner battle to maintain human decency in the face of something so horrible to imagine. It is the struggle and the reflection on what we do in the same position that makes this book such an interesting read. The author's style allows enough detail to imagine what's happening to unfold like a movie in your head but not be so overly descriptive that you lose out on the story events. My question- who could portray Strain on film. I did like her depiction as a strong female, a consummate professional.

This book is almost like a writers experiment.  What would happen if some crazy alien just showed up?  I think the author did a good job of portraying how people and governments would respond.  The characters are interesting and well developed.
I'm not one to rave about sci-fi but this little book was great. interesting start, into the book right away. loved the way the author developed the characters and the ending is a surprise
This book is amazing...a new favorite writer!  If you like sci-fi, and more importantly, excellent writing, read this book now.

This was an unusual book. I did not quite love it but I have to say that it kept me coming back to find out what was going to happen next. The ending really threw me and was really surprising. Never in a million years would I have imagined that ending. Definitely worth reading.

A few days after I finished reading The Stone Man & I'm still pondering on it, with "what if's" & wondering how I'd react to such a scenario. It was frightening & I felt so much sympathy for the characters, especially when something I'd wondered about did actually happen. (No spoilers here, people!) I enjoyed reading it very much & will be reading more by this author.

Cool story! It(TSM) really kept my interest , I think I wanted more(or maybe just a fairy tale ending). As a reader from a very small town in the US it seems that I don't always immediately grasp some of the phrasing of a writer from across the pond but it wasn't such a gap that it interrupted my enjoyment of your book! Really sir you better get cracking ,I'm devouring book 4 of TBR and I find myself wanting to know how it ends, but not wanting it to end. If that makes any sense at all:)  Thank-you Mr Luke Smitherd,please keep writing so I can tell people that I read you before you were super rich and famous.

Luke Smitherd presented this unique plot with finesse. Gritty characterization and the careful handling of foreshadowing made it highly readable.  Some gratuitous physicality and language detracted minimally from my enjoyment of it. Or maybe I just hate to think that people are really so oafish.
Really enjoyed this book.  A unique take on the "invasion" genre that has a very satisfying end. Strongly recommend to all SciFi buffs.
Ok Luke, here's my brief comments. Good read, alittle wordy,  great story, re-edit was worth it maybe one typo and a couple garbled phrases. Will try one of your other books. Hang in there.

Was intrigued through the whole book. Didn't know what was next. Did like the ending after a few days of thinking about it. Crazy!! I have recommended this to my husband and son to read. Usually don't do that.
The Stone Man takes you deeply into the human psyche during this unusual thriller. It kept me glued to the pages which made it hard to sleep. Highly recommend the read.
The story combined enough humanity to hold my interest. The failure to tie into any known science kept me from giving it the fifth star.

An awful nightmare comes to life.  Two strangers become entwined in a harrowing new reality.  A different kind of sci-fi book.  I rather enjoyed it.  It had the occasional doubled word or phrase.  Fairly typo free overall.  A bit slow going in the early part of the book.  Interesting characters and a fresh look at how different people deal with their impending doom.  Well worth checking out!

Luke Smitherd is a great storyteller with much intelligence and originality. His prose includes current humor and sensitivity. A very cerebral thriller with the element of science fiction throughout. Superior quality of writing and very real emotion throughout, highly recommended for readers who don't usually go for science fiction.
I thoroughly enjoyed this book. Another book I did not want to put down. Different from other sci-fi books that I've read. It's a good read, give it a try....

Smitherd hits on  unique situation and gives it a classic sci-fi treatment. He weaves a tale which is quite imaginable in contrast to a lot of recent entries into the genre. He grabs your interest early and keeps it with steady momentum all the way through. If I had an objection it would be that the book ends 88% through the pages. a full 10% of the books mass is a kind of self promotional statement that begs reviews. So believing that there was some twist or epilogue yet to come, instead the book ended rather suddenly. But that aside, Luke Smitherd wove a great tale and I encourage others who enjoy science fiction that is strong on the characters and merely uses sci-fi as the vehicle to read this book. It's a very decent work.
An interesting read...what to do when death is coming and you know you are the target, but you also know your death can save thousands more. Looking forward to reading more of his books!
This book is a very different, very clever story.  I truly had fun reading this puzzler, and I'm sure you will too!
After completing this book it left me wondering what was next.  It kept me reading and was pretty well written.  I am looking forward to the next book in this series.
Original and entertaining story. Seemed to lose speed towards the latter half of book, but good revised ending! And it was as free, can't beat that!

Great, original story.  The characters were riveting and their development was in depth.  Luke Smitherd has amazing command of the language.  Loved it!  Just finished The Man at Table Ten and enjoyed it as much!  Keep 'em coming, Luke.  Your books are a joy to read.
Would recommend this book to any sci-fi lover! Keep's you wondering what is next and keeps you wanting to turn the next page .

This is such a fresh Science Fiction novel..the description of the stone men was freaky and the ending could not have been any better. Luke Smitherd you ROCK! This is one of the most unique science fiction thrillers I've read (and I've read tons) it's such a fresh concept.
I enjoyed this book. It was different and fresh. I would have given it 5 stars except that I think it was a bit longer than was necessary. Worth your time.

Luke Smitherd has managed to come up with a unique invasion story.  I was caught up almost immediately, which is unusual for me. The characters were believable, the story intense, and I found myself unable to put the book down. The only disappointment is that there too few books by Mr. Smitherd.

Just finished reading THE STONE MAN.  I couldn't put it down!  I liked the fact that the story line is unresolved.  I would love to post a synopsis and a critique, but I have been reading for many hours straight and my mind is a bit fuzzy.  Sorry Mr. Smitherd.  Let it just stand that I would recommend this novel.

The author is more than a craftsman with words; he is an artist,creating a world complicated with difficult choices but clear in asking some difficult questions which left me thinking for weeks.  The story moves quickly, is filled with action,and even if you read it only on the plot level it is excellent.  The characters are well developed, multi-dimensional,  and very human.  They are so real I kept wanting to jump in and ask them questions or offer advice, but, alas, that was not possible.  This is a book I would strongly recommend, but be prepared, you will want to purchase more of his writing.
this is a good read. i liked it, though it is a little unusual in its presentation. but good sci fi.
Interesting plot with a bit of introspection of the characters. Well put together with good development. Interesting twist at the end.
Each chapter kept me guessing. I hate reading a bunch of chapters that really don't have a lot to do with the plot. This was not the case. I like when I Cant  figure out the next part.

Having read other books by Mr. Smitherd  I needed to read this one as well. What I like about this book is he develops his characters well. He has original ideas. The ending  will stay with you for awhile. Can't wait to read more from him.

I wasn't sure if I would like this when I "bought" it for free.  But when I started reading it, I was completely sucked in.  I enjoyed every word of this novel.  I usually do not like books taken place in England (or whever they use colour instead of color), but it didn't bother me in the least in this book, because I just had to keep reading.  Interesting ending as well.  Not at all what I was expecting.  I would highly recommend this book.

I thought I would have a hard time wrapping my head around an alien "Stone Man" but Luke Smitherd pulls it off brilliantly!  Kept me wanting to read until the end to find out what happens next!! Highly entertaining!!
This story was very different than anything I have read in a long while.  The ending was unusual and unexpected.  I don't want to spoil it.  I was engrossed until the end.
Well crafted and unusual.  Fast-paced, continued action keeps the reader interested.  I recommend it to any lover of science fiction or fantasy.

Very well written.  Unusual theme worth exploring. The transition to Paul's view completed the story.  I recommend this story to all sifi readers and look forward to discovering more of Luke's stories.
Moved along nicely, character development good but not overdone, not overly wordy.  Unique and interesting premise.  Look forward to reading more of Smitherd's books.
I really enjoyed this story and highly recommend it. I will read more by this author for sure and have already purchased my next one from him!

"The Stone Man" is a very enjoyable read.  Author Smitherd crafts a suspenseful tale that kept me engaged.  I also liked his author notes at the end of the telling me more about himself, why he writes, and asking for reader support.  He has mine.
The premise of the stone man was so simple, but very scary I thought. Good suspense. I enjoyed it. If I could ask the author one question, it would be, "what about the ocean?"

I've been binge reading science fiction since the late 60's, don't recall a central idea quite like this one. I liked it, and once I hit the 60% mark was compelled to finish it in a single session. On to "The Black Room!"
I enjoyed the storyline and the premise!  It's a good read and I'm looking forward to reading more by this author.

I don't think I have read something so good for so long. I must equate this book as a modern day War of the Worlds.  The same but without all of the philosophical junk that writers of the 19th century felt they must put in every book. Thank you Luke, May I call you that? You feel like a friend. I read nothing but sci-fi with Stephen King thrown in for good measure and this is by far one of the best. Luke Smitherd, remember that name!!

The Stone Man by Luke Smitherd is one of the best most original science fiction books I have read in a long time. The characters are very real and believable, I could not put it down. My next move is to look for more books by Smothers. I can't wait for someone to make this into a movie. If you like science fiction read this. If you like a good story with interesting people in it,read this. Thank you Mr. Smitherd!
well written and a great science fiction story, not at all what you would expect.  Recommended reading for the since fiction buff.
This book reads lke a sci-fi classic.  While I agree with one reviewer regarding editing, the book was a real page-turner for me!  I look forward to reading more of Mr. Smitherd's wriings!
Great read didn't want it to end looking forward to the next great read from this author.Will there be a sequel?
Interesting premise but dwelt too much on guilt.  Mostly well paced but had a few slow spots.  Well worth a read.
The story line was so unusual, that it kept me interested. I got really bumbed out at the ending though. It just stopped! Like the author couldn't figure out a way to resolve the problem.

My one sentence review first. The plot moves as slowly as the title character. Now for a little more detail. While the premise is interesting there just isn't enough for a full length novel in my opinion. Because of that there is a lot of filler and repetition. My solution to that problem was skimming over the material. I did read throughout to the somewhat anticlimactic finish( the author did provide a somewhat more satisfying alternate ending). The writing was okay, the main characters were fleshed out fairly well. I give it three stars because I really believe that this is a book which while fairly well written will not impress the serious science fiction fan very much.
Not a bad book.  Plot was OK kind of interesting, yet the ending seemed abrupt without binging much to a close.
This was an interesting book with a new twist on invasion from outer space. The only thing I found frustrating was the long personal anecdote at the end. Good story though....
The Stone Man is an Entertaining story that was well executed. An interesting commentary on the human psyche and what it takes to keep people moving forward while faced with adversity.

It was a totally different science fiction thriller then I have ever read.  And it was based in UK so that was very interesting also.  The main character spoke to you though most of the book which I liked.  He used the F word a few times so I wouldn't recommend a young reader read this book.  The author's description of the characters and places make you feel like you were there.  I could hardly put the book down.  It was really very good.  I'm reading the authors next book The Black Room and enjoying that book as well. I highly recommend this book and this author.

this story was a big surprise.  I had no expectations. It started slowly, but became increasingly intriguing.  Extremely clever.  I want to read more from this author.  The comments by the author at the end gave me some insight into the mind of someone who could write such an interesting and thought provoking story.  Hope he writes another to make it a series.

I have always enjoyed sci-fi, and this was a great read! I didn't want to put it down. The storyline is as plausible as sci-fi can be, and the characters were so real! I got this book through Bookbub, and it's been my favorite Bookbub pick by far!

I am not usually a fan of science fiction but the premise sounded interesting so I bought it.  I enjoyed this book very much and would recommend it to anyone who is looking for something a little different.

Anyone who is looking for a story with a bit of everything wrapped up in a unique science fiction plot will enjoy this book. Fascinating, humorous, scary and sad, a study of the changes an unexpected and unfathomable experience makes in these characters and their lives.

The story is definitely intriguing and the author doesn't let it get too bogged down. You really do wonder what is going on and try to piece together a plausible explanation while waiting for the author to reveal it to you.
Good read. Hard to put down. Found myself trying to stretch it out to make it last, it was that good.
Interesting concept, just different enough to maybe be real. Intriguing  from beginning to end. I believe it ended the only way possible. Well done

This book held my interest from page 1 through the end.  The pages revealed the differing personalities of the two main characters and how they finally managed to understand and like each other.  Yes, it was a bit frightening as I put myself in their positions, but not so scary so as to stop me from reading every word until the end.  I did like this book a lot.

The plot started out in a ho-hum pace since the protagonist is starting his missive to the world about his experiences that eventually leads him to the eerie Stone Man. The hilarity begins when he, as former newspaper reporter, attempts to interview the young dude who claims to have been the first in the crowd to witness the frightening materialization of the Stone Man. The exchanges of dialog and repartee between the reporter and the young Irish man along with the witness' scared behavior are really comical. The plot picks up speed from that point on, which compels the reader to not put the book down until the finish, trying to second guess how it all ends. The author (Smithered) also introduced a female Army general who's all business-like in taking charge of the chaotic situation arising when the Stone Man starts moving and creates death and destructions along his seemingly unstoppable path. I really enjoyed this sci-fi story.

I got this book without reading reviews first.  I was hooked by the little blurb, and just went for it!  In the event it hasn't been stated outright, this book is British, not American English.  That's not a problem at all (in fact it adds to the charm of the tale), but at first it kinda threw me.  This was a nice departure from a lot of what I've been reading lately, and I did enjoy the story. Wish it had a more interesting ending, but that happens sometimes. I liked so many of the characters, and the flow of the story from Andy's viewpoint. I have already downloaded 3 more books from this author, and will continue to look for more in the future.  Well worth a look!
The concept of the book intrigued me - and overall it was a good read - the ending left a lot to be desired.  I don't think I could read another book from this author because of the ending.
This one will grab you and keep you interested. I am a Steven King fan and this story held my attention.
This is an awesome memorable story that will haunt my thoughts for a long time.  However, I was so disgusted with the nasty language that I struggled to deal with the annoyance and enjoy the story.

The Stone Man has it all - twists of fate, genuine terror, unsurpassed empathy, cruel objectivity, desperation, resignation vs. determined challenge. I was pulled into the plot, much the same as Andy and Paul were pulled together. The clever ending left me questioning if Paul's solution was worth his compromise. This riveting adventure rates all five stars!

At the author's request, I'm leaving a short review.  I'm no good at book reviews and this book was simply wonderful.  I couldn't do it justice if I tried.  A writer myself, sometimes a storyline will grab me and not let go.  I wonder, "How did s/he come up with this?!"  This was one of those.  Those are always pleasantly surprising.  As not to ruin anything, I'll simply say that if you like Sci-Fi, a bit of humor, and mystery, you will thoroughly enjoy this book!

Excellent read and highly original plot and underlying premise.  Must read for science fiction fans.  Well-written and building excitemnet and interest until the very end.  Couldn't stop reading it but was sorry to see it end. Loved it!

This is one of the most original pieces of fiction I've read in a long while. The story swept me along, kept me up, exhausted me (see: "kept me up"), enraged me (because I didn't think of it first), and thoroughly entertained me. Well worth your time.

I loved this book.  It sucked me in & kept me right there until it was over.  I don't care what kind of story you call it or if it had editing issues, that's not why I read everything I can get my paws on.  Mostly I wonder where the ideas come from?  Dreams? Off the back of milk cartons?  I envy the mind that can pull out stories like this.  Could be I that identified with the main character because my best online friend's name is Andy and is from Yorkshire :P  I've read The Man On Table Ten & am in the middle of The Dark Room. I will read everything this guy writes.  Smithereen? hmmm ok

Good novel, well written, no typos, good use of characterization. The main protagonist was crafted quite well, with self awareness of his own unlikable characteristics making him feel both intelligent and realistic to this reader. I will read another book by this author, and, in my opinion, he deserves to be published in traditional format.

Interesting premise. It took a few minutes to get into the flow with the main character motor-mouthing in the first few pages.... The story slowed in the middle and because very slow at the end. There was too much detail during the ending sequence, then the finale fell flat for me. I know writers want to leave their options open for a sequel, but the ending was limp.
Riveting from the start. I could not put it down. Excellent characterization and plot twists and turns. I agree with others who wished the ending were different but I still give it a must read 5.

Great, easy to read story in the vein of The Day the Earth Stood Still.  The excitement and tension is palpable and keeps you hooked till the end. Solid science fiction narrative that makes you think of what you would do in the same situation.
I really enjoyed reading this book. It hooked me from the start and kept me turning my kindle back on even if just for a few paragraphs.

I really liked this book.  Every character was fully developed and had real strengths and weaknesses.  This seems lost in a lot of the sci fi books available for Kindle.  The perspective was first person and this is also rare and exciting to read.  I hope to see many more books from this author and will gladly read them.
It took a bit to get started, but once it did...... Wow! This was a great premise, an excellent story, and good writing.
What an interesting book. Mr. Smitherd is a great storyteller. I recommend any of his books for lovers of reading.

Luke, you asked people that read the book to post a review so here goes.  The writing style, flow and themes are well done, and make for an enjoyable read.  The plot lays out an interesting twist on the old idea that you can't kill the boogeyman. it explores a bit of interesting ethical territory when we discover not only that boogeyman can't be killed, but that everyone else wants the boogeyman to get you.  Nicely done Luke, and I'll be on the lookout for more of your books.

Not a page-turner, but one you don't have to re-read to remember the story when you pick up the book to continue.  That's very rare in my experience.  The story stays with you.  Not a flashy pair of heroes, just a couple of guys caught up in something extraordinary.  I enjoyed it.  You can read the synopses in the other reviews.

This was the first of Luke's books that I have read and it will certainly not be the last.  In my opinion this story is worth far more than the asking price and I truly hope to see Luke's talent continue to develop and read many more of his works in the future.

The story kept me riveted all the way through to the end ... and beyond.  I loved Luke's writing style  -  nice story telling Luke!  The worlds of Andy and Paul materialized vividly for me and I want to read more of Luke's stories.  Count me in!

After finishing this novel today, I'm feeling a sense of loss - I want more of these characters and this story, but the best I can hope for is to buy more of this author's writing. Rarely do I come across a self-published novel of such quality. I've been reading classic sci-fi novels since childhood, especially enjoying the ones by famous authors of the past, like Heinlein and Bradbury, and I think Smitherd has the potential to be in their class. Although this novel includes more profanity than I'd prefer, the story itself was well worth the read - intriguing, somewhat chilling, and thoroughly entertaining. The main character rings true as a real person who grows and changes over the course of the events in the story. This one will stick with me. Well done, Mr Smitherd. Oh, and thanks for including the alternate ending - it gave me the sense of closure I needed.

I really enjoyed this book- I was hooked within the first few pages.  The author was able to keep the pace moving throughout, while maintaining the suspense about what might happen next.  Great plot, great and believable main characters- what more can you ask?  Look forward to more from Mr. Smitherd.

I liked this book because it was really original in its story line. At first I thought the descriptions of the characters' thoughts was a little overdone, but as the book progressed I warmed to this type of writing. I found this story very engrossing, in fact I finished reading in a very short time. I read science fiction almost exclusively this was a nice change from space battles and high tech.

Mr. Smitherd has the makings of a primo author.  His writing style is nearly on a par with his gifted imagination.  This novel keenly holds your attention, as it keeps you guessing throughout.  His characters are very well drawn at the same time being quite personal to the reader.  I particularly enjoyed his seamless transition from Andy's first person/protagonist viewpoint to the third-person narrative of Paul's ultimate fate.  On the down side, good Si-Fi, as with any good mystery or thriller, demands a denouement, which among other things, provides some plausible explanation of the mystery.  Here, Mr. Smitherd fails to give us even an inkling as to why the super-human blue Stone Men needed living human brain-stem/spinal tissue to be created and/or function.  Are we to assume that the original Stone Man was also supplied with human tissue before the novel begins?  Paul's ultimate fate being left ambiguous is fine, but unanswered pivotal questions ultimately leave one disappointed rather than begging for more.

I'm a time-travel and interplanetary science fiction fan.  After a while, I began to see a lot of similarities in all I read.  Boring... I found the "STONE MAN" just shopping around, read a few reviews, and bought it for my tablet.  Reading it was an adventure!  A real fast moving, page-turner...I thoroughly enjoyed it, although it was scary.  Thankfully, no zombies to get in the way.  I hated the fact that it left me hanging at the end. (a teaser, maybe?) A totally engrossing read.  I think you'll like it too.
I really enjoyed it and I'm starting Black Room #1 now. hope it's as good or even better. keep writing!
It took a bit to get into, but, once I did it was hard to put down. The characters were likable,that's a big plus!

I really enjoyed the storyline of this book and felt that I got to know the main characters well.  Its a real page turner, especially towards the end. I would have given it 5 stars, but it had a few too many editing issues.  I'll definitely be looking for more of his work.

This story is too real..Mr. Smitherd does such a good job of making his characters real people, and the tale is scary because you are convinced it could really be happening. I enjoyed it thoroughly and have The Man on Table Ten to start next.
Not normally what I choose to read but so glad I did. A thrilling ride the entire read!!  I actually felt like I was there.

Believable, engaging characters, no big plot holes (what happened to the rented motorbike?) a solid story and great pacing.  Thoroughly enjoyed it and sorry to have reached the end.  Good work, Luke.  I give it an eleven.

I want to give this five stars, I really do. I know this was trending in the horror charts but I thought of it as sci-fi (not scary in  a horror way for me). I am a fan for sure, and I have already left reviews for The Black Room parts one and two. A good story by a good storyteller and I am sure the stories will only get better. I couldn't give it five stars though, because of one thing that bugged me. The "Asperger's" character. Writing about characters with Aspergers has become an in thing, it seems and I would caution this author, and any other author, to avoid the temptation. I know that it seems like it just makes for an interesting character, but as someone whose son actually has been diagnosed with Asperger's, it always leaves me cold. Asperger's is a syndrome. They are not stock characters that you can develop off a list. Every Asperger's kid is different. For instance the "no empathy" is a stereotype. My son has hyper-empathy, for lack of a better way of putting it, and when stereotypes are created, it creates assumptions that create problems (as in schooling). You see I gave it 4 stars, so I wasn't deeply offended, just bugged. I'm a bit sick of all the Asperger's characters cropping up, is all. Despite this, I enjoyed the book and would recommend it to anyone wanting a good and entertaining read.

Not my usual choice of genre. Luke's style of writing quickly grabbed me and didn't let go until the last page. Even then I'm still thinking about the ending, which I liked. It is a well paced read and I'd recommend it.
I couldn't put it down. Couldn't decide if I liked the vagueness of the ending or if I wanted a clear cut finish. It does make you think.
Good, original story. Nicely executed. Needs a bit more proofreading to bring it to 5 stars but well worth reading.

Great read from start to finish. As a fan of science fiction ~ this has it all. An alien race,  unstoppable forces and courageous guys. They will have you cheering them on, feeling their pain and getting your heart racing. One of my favorite reads so far this year. Awesome job. Looking forward to more books by Luke Smitherd.

Engrossing, complex, philosophical, thought-provoking.  An alien invasion that addresses those unpleasant details, both personal and political, that other stories have glossed over.  The main character can be a little annoying at times, but then, who isn't?  The ending might disappoint some readers, but seems reasonable to me.  The story pours out at break-neck speed and leaves you asking yourself some of the self-same questions about your own ethics and psyche.  A good read but probably not for everyone.

Although I'm not a big sci-fi fan, I really loved this book. I even let my kid watch an extra TV show so I could see what was going to happen next! I look forward to reading more books by this author.
I couldn't put this down until I finished.reading it  What a great ending!  First science fiction story I have read that was so unlike any other I have read.  Definitely worth reading.

This won't win a Hugo, but it's a credible effort.  The story bogs down in a few places, but it kept me entertained and interested to the end.  Unlike some reviewers, I think the open ending was a wise decision (reminiscent of The Twilight Zone).  The best part was the central figure of the Stone Man.  This was an imaginative concept that will stick with me for awhile.

I wasn't sure what to expect from this book, but I really liked it. I won't go into the storyline here because many other reviewers have done that.  I don't usually read sci-fiction, but this story had me from almost the beginning.  I liked that the main character was not always likable, but he was honest about his feelings and life.  Very good story that does make you wonder how you would react (morally?) in similar situations.  Also, makes you think that sure something like this happening is possible.  I will definitely be reading more of Luke Smitherd's work.

This book makes you stop and wonder what you would do if this was actually happening in your neck of the woods! Tell you what....no one knows if there is really anybody else out there of if they would want to use us as "their cattle" or materials to make their product.Although this book was a little long,...I happen to love long books.I have already read The man on table ten (TMOTT)and The Black Room(TBR).Those were great! Like I stated in my last review, I am now a Smithereen. Next is The Physics of the Dead(TPOTD). Will have to hunt for another one after that. You won't regret reading this. I stayed with it pretty constant only putting it down for a potty break!

Loved this book, but it's hard to read at night. Besides not wanting to put it down, it has your heart racing and your adrenaline pumping through most of it.. I'm a very tired reader this morning. Can not wait to get my hands on the rest of his books. Luke Smitherd has a new fan right here.
Science ficción of a different sort.Movies like a Tv series.Should considera trying that.Needs more "puré science theory though.😉Would like to ser that.
Excellent read. Loved the story and look forward to reading some more books by Luke Smitherd. Off to The Black Room now.

I loved the whole "walking stone man until it found its target" plot and how Andy and Paul were so connected to the Stone Man. All of the characters were believable with human flaws and aspirations. When the book ended, I first thought, "dang!" and then I sat re-reading the end a couple of times and realized that I liked the ending just as it was. I highly recommend this to anyone who enjoys good ole classic science fiction.
As I already stated, I loved this book.  Great story line and I enjoyed the author's writing style.  Looking forward to more of his books. Thanks so much for a great free story.
I love science fiction, and this was a very good plot, but it was a little bit too wordy for my taste>

As a young man I read quite a bit of the classic sci-fi authors such as Bradbury, Asimov, and Heinlein. I think this author with this story follows in that tradition and that's quite an accomplishment.

I've been a huge SF fan since childhood. I found this book very interesting. It was slow going at the start, though. It is in need of heavy editing - lots of missing words in sentences. Still, I recommend this book, just hang in there past the main protagonist's navel-gazing. Note to author: would LOVE to read a sequel or series based on this book.
while it's a little slow getting started all in all. it's quite a good story. the shifting of viewpoints is well done. May we know where the stone men came from?

While reading this novel, I was constantly surprised at the innovative thinking taking place. I usually am able to predict a story line and then it becomes redundant. I was impressed with the way it continually had me guessing! I want to read more.

This book was entertaining because the theme was different than anything I'd read. The story has realistic characters and a detailed plot. I'd like to have had a bit more "why" (the science geek in me) but it is not necessary,  as it would have deteacred from the reality of the story. Great fun to read!

What a deep, thought-provoking, addictive and creative ride.  The ending left a little to the imagination, but it did not feel unfinished; it was more disappointing only because I didn't want the book to end.  Highly original - I will certainly be seeking out more of Luke Smitherd's work.

I love it when I can't figure out how a tale will end...not something I purposely try to do, it just "is" the way I read & I read ALOT. It's not that I have nothing else to do, it's more of a I have to keep my brain occupied so I don't keep hatching plans for world domination while I do the dishes...wait, sorry, got confused with too many "Pinky& the Brain" memories, but I digress..."TSM" kept me intrigued. Appreciated the inclusion of an alternate ending too(will especially help those readers who must have a "tidy" summation)... anyway, I recommend that you read this book, then go & visit Luke's website to learn more about him & the other stories available. His blogs are very entertaining too..(no, he didn't pay me to write this).Thanks Luke! Keep writing, publishing & entertaining us.

An interesting concept. I enjoyed the plot, the building of the characters with their very human flaws facing an inhuman adversary. Cool, very cool! I very much enjoyed the book. Will have to check out his first book.
Flawed and believable characters dealing with something amazing and dreadful.  It was a fun read all the way through; I really enjoyed it!

This is a good book but a little too verbose at times, especially at the beginning.  I also have to agree with one other reader that the ending is just odd.  I really did enjoy the story line.  Want to see how this writer fairs with experience, that oh so trusty teacher!!

I really enjoyed reading The Stone Man.  Fast paced and interesting.  Fresh perspective on an alien invasion scenario.  I don't usually read sci-fi, but this one really held my attention.  It didn't seem to far-fetched or forced.

RARLEY DO I FIND A BOOK THAT GRIPS ME LIKE THIS ONE DID.....I WAS SO HOOKED...COULD NOT PUT IT DOWN. WHEN I FOUND OUT THE AUTHOR WAS UNPUBLISHED I LAUGHED OUT LOUD...THIS IS LIKE STEPHEN KING OR DEAN KOONTZ IN THEIR EARLY YEARS ( THEIR BEST). I WANTED TO TELL EVEYONE ABOUT IT AFTER I READ IT. THAT SAYS A LOT FOR ME
It was a fun read,the characters were all to human in a good way.i enjoyed  reading it and it took me awhile to figure out where it was going ,which I always try to do when I read.
This novel explores a new idea about how a human alien encounter might take place. The story is suspenseful and impossible to predict.

This book is totally unlike anything I've ever read before, I couldn't put it down. Andy and Paul are the two most real and likable characters and their dialogue was very believable. The whole concept of moving stone aliens that rip the spines out of people just makes me shudder. I just wish I knew how long poor Paul had to stay in his rolling cabin being chased by the Stone Man.

I am not really an avid reader, I am selective on the books I do read.  The story by Mr. Smitherd had me glued to my Kindle, I could not put it down.  I really enjoyed the story a lot!  I cared for the characters and what was happening to them, this is odd for me.  So, kudos to you Mr. Smitherd, you have written a winner!  Now, we need to get the story told on the big screen.  I think this story would make an awesome movie.

Such a compelling story, with beautifully detailed and believable characters and a well structured plot. I can't recommend this book highly enough. I am so happy to have discovered this writer, and I will be reading his other books immediately!

I normally don't read sci-fi novels but the premise of this story sounded so intriguing I decided to give it a try. I'm glad I did. It took a little while for me to get into it but once I did it was hard to put down. I don't want to give anything away so I will just say that Andy surprised me at the end. I was glad the author published an alternate ending at the back of the book as I preferred that one. I've never been a big fan of the ambiguous ending. I will say the book could use a little editing but it doesn't take away from the story. All in all a good read and I would definitely read more from this author.
Excellent read! Writer did an excellent job and he kept me glued to the pages to see what would happen next.

I don't know what kind of mind comes up with this type of storyline, but he did a good job on it.  Very original and entertaining.  Hope the author can continue to write and get these off the wall story lines.

Took a chance on this one. I'm glad I did. The writing style was different than my typical reads. Definitely European idiom  and references caused  me to slow  my reading pace and think more deeply about what I just read. I found that to be refreshing. The subject matter and the characters were very interesting and the open ending was unexpected and nontypical. I would enthusiastically recommend this book to others. Good job Mr Smitherd!! I will read more of your selections...

This was a strangely compelling book. It is different from anything else I've ever read. Though the plot seemed completely unplausible, the author made it work, and I found myself sinking deeper and deeper into the story. Overall, despite the crazy premise, it was well written and compelling. Though the term is overused, this, for me, was truly a page turner which I found hard to put down and also found myself thinking about when I wasn't reading it. Unlike some others, I thought the author ended it just right. Life often doesn't have clean, wrapped-up endings. Anyway, I highly recommend this book to not only science fiction lovers, but to anyone who is looking for a unique, exciting read--one that will leave you thinking about long after you read the last page.
I do not like to be told that I have to write a certain amount in order to post but IDE an exception for you. You did a good job I liked it a lot
I was SO impressed that I went to his page and purchased all of his other books immediately.  Enough said.
I loved this book.  Keep them coming.  Science fiction at its best.  I couldn't put it down til the end.

I am not a big reader of sci fi thrillers but I enjoy this book, it catches your interest has a easy flow. The only thing I did not like was then ending, I really prefer a ending you know good guy saves the day and evil stone man is destroyed. I would recommend this book.
Very much enjoyed the story and the conversational writing style. Had to keep reading so finished at 1AM.  Keep writing Luke!  I am a fan.

Starting off, I thought I was getting a medley of "the day the earth stood still" and " encounters of the third kind".  It is SO much fund to categorize and trash ebooks!  But wait, I got hooked and enjoyed this one.  The story is fresh and descriptions  inviting.  It has plenty of character development, though not in an overpowering way.  The plot moves nicely, with a few twists that you might see coming, but still don't mind waiting for.  And a surprise or two...Heck, I'd love to rehash the plot and let you know how much I liked reading this one, but I don't want to spoil it, and I can't convince you to just pick it up and start.  Or I would.
Good sciFi read. I enjoyed both endings! Would recommend to anyone. The price can't be beat. I will be downloading more from this author.

Very original and compelling story. Main characters are human and flawed and very much everyman. Its the kind of science fiction I grew up on and would love to see make a comeback. A bit of a slow start then builds to a I-cant't-put-it-down page-turner. Write on!
Loved it, the stone man held my attention all the way through. Could not put it down. Pulls at your heartstrings.
Highly thought provoking - forcing me to contemplate what my actions would be if placed in the same situations.  I'll remember this story for quite awhile.

I really enjoyed this book, and I was surprised as the story unfolded.  The idea of this destructive stone man plowing across the country was one I have come across in my many years of reading. Genius!  I would also like to say that I enjoyed the cuss words, because that always makes a story more believable for me, as I use them myself.  I liked the flow of the book and the characters were very believable.  Andy is a slut, but that was totally in character. ;  )  I preferred the ending you decided on, but enjoyed reading the alternate.  I would like to thank you for all your hard work, it paid off!

I gave this book a 5-star rating because it was very interesting, imaginative, fluid and most of all kept me interested. I felt as if I were right there in the scene being so well described to me. I read mainly at night when going to bed and my only dislike was waking up finding my Kindle had fallen out of the bed. Great job and I highly recommend reading this book.

I enjoyed this book very much.  The plot was different and surprising. Sometimes I feel that the as  Kindle books are not thoroughly developed. I'd rather read a Harry Potter length novel than four or five novellas.
I found this work to be quite original. And, I looked forward every day to reading it that night. Looking forward to more from this author.

My first by this author. A little slow at first, and a little rambling, but it all comes together. It gives you a lot to consider as the story develops. I will get more of this author's work to see if he is as good as I think he is. Overall a very good read.

AFTER A SLOW START, the characters jump out and pull you along with them.  The personality of each is neatly interwoven. The psychological up and downs of each marks this a fun, quick page turning adventure.

This is a Science Fiction novel that isn't really about science at all. It's really a great thriller with some minor science fiction elements. Great read. I liked his writing style and look forward to reading more of Luke Smitherd's novels.
Not what I expected- most of my scifi is in the Star Trek genre- and I had my doubts. But I really enjoyed it... descriptions were very clear and plot moves very well. Will read more of his work!
I gotta say, I like the premise. Good plot development, though I did foresee some of  the progression. I would recommend this work for anyone who enjoys the genre!

not your typical science fiction novel. very different from the norm. a very original concept. I enjoyed the pacing. the author makes the stone men move at a slow pace, but everything is going at breakneck speed.

I have plowed through more than my share of formulaic, cardboard-charactered fiction in my 54 years as a bookaholic. And as I love to save a dollar as much as I love to read, I am constantly downloading free or low-cost self-published ebooks. Most of which leave a bad, sad taste in my bibliophile maw, only proving (as usual), that Mom and Dad were right --- "you get what you pay for". BUT this book is the exception to that rule. It was intriguing, I felt for the characters, the situation was believable (as far as sci-fi can be), the pacing was good, the plot turns unexpected. This book was far better than most of what I've read in the last year and certainly good enough for me to recommend to my 30-year old son. I will be looking to download more books from this author, and encourage anyone who enjoys a well-told story to do the same, starting with this one.
Fun and thought provoking read. Not you average scifi thriller.  Luke must be a hoot to chat with after a couple of beers.
Original idea......well thought out.....scary concept....I really enjoyed this.....good character development.....hard to put down......hope he writes more....maybe a stone man sequel?
A nightmare described in thrilling detail, The Stone Man is a quick weekend read that will keep you turning the pages all the way.  Highly recommended. Give it a go, you won't be disappointed.
Smartly written and with just a hint of bravado in the principles  to be believable. This really needs to be made into a Blockbuster movie, Thanks for the great involving read.!

This short novel was a page-turner for me.  I was taken with the author's development of the idea of utter relentlessness.  I so appreciate authors that leave me thinking through issues long after the book is finished.  Bravo, Luke.  You 'kindled' connections in my own thinking about things like the second law, morality, and the problem of death.  The characters were both unlikely and perfect in their roles.  Thanks for birthing this book!
What a great read.  T have always liked sci do and this one keeps you going.  Could this really happen?

Like the title says, very cool story. I hate writing these things because I don't want to give anything away, so I'll just say it's a really well put together sci-fi story. And that's what I judge on, the story. I let editing and spelling errors slide if something keeps me pushing the "next page" button. (It sucks not to be able to call something a "page turner" anymore doesn't it?) And check my other reviews, I'm pretty stingy with my stars. If your a sci-fi fan, at this price, what do you have to lose?
Very enjoyable! I didn't want to put it down until I found out how things would play out. I would definitely recommend it to everyone.

A fascinating book about what a nation would do when confronted with a seemingly invincible enemy. The story is told in the first person near the end of the crisis, or so you you are led to believe. There is a lot of self reflection as to whether the right thing is being done, but in the end it is decided that the good of the many is more important than the good of the one.
Good story and well told. Interesting characters throughout. Would read more from this author and I'm sure he will do wdll

I don't often write a review, not sure why really. I know I should, I just don't. The stone man and it's creator deserve five stars however and a review. The book is stunning on so many levels. Please Mr. Smitherd don't. You ever stop writting. A fan for life.
I enjoyed reading this book. I thought it was well written, although I'm no book critic. It kept me coming back for more! I would read more of Luke Smitherd's work, and I probably will! Enjoy!
This book was an excellent read!  The characters are really well written and the story really hooks you in.  I look forward to more from this author!

When I was a kid I'd look at a picture of the Mount Rushmore and wonder what it would be like to see the presidents come to life and start talking.  The Stone Man asks the same question to some extent... what happens when statues start walking thru, and I literally mean thru, the countryside?  If you want an exciting page turner that is half scifi, a dash techno-thriller and a part Stephen King, then this is something you should download and read.
Clever, the author is a talented storyteller.  I am now reading The Black Room and will continue to read his work.

The author does a very good job of putting the reader in the moment.  Characters are well developed and totally believable.  The scenario, while not substantially technical, is extremely thought provoking and does a fine job portraying the human element and our ability to rise to the occasion.  I look forward to reading more from Mr. Smitherd.

Mr Smitherd is a great thinker and he is able to channel that talent into an exciting reading experience ( I swear I have never typed that sentence before)... I look forward to reading more from this author and I recommend this book anytime the opportunity arises.

This guy is the real deal, and The Stone Man is a gem!  I read a lot of speculative fiction, including a lot of emergent writers, and this is one of the best I've come across (as, apparently, many readers in the UK know).  The concept was simple but very compelling, and I couldn't put it down.  Wish I were rich: I'd send Mr. Smitherd some cash to keep up the good work!

This book was my first introduction to Luke Smitherd. I was instantly fascinated with the uniqueness of this story. It was such a fun read, I admit to staying up waaay too late each night unable to put it down. Every other book of Luke's has been such a different experience. I highly recommend reading this and everything else he has published so far.

One of the most engrossing, original novels I have read in years! The author gives us  clear insight into the workings of the hero's mind as the world changes after a statue goes on the move. No spoilers from me - just read it if you like nerve-racking psychological suspense and a story that is totally new, loaded with ideas that several times had me clicking away from my Kindle to check to see if this was a NEW scarey thing or if science already knows about it. Not often am I lucky enough to find a novel that I cannot put down but this one, whoa... Whatta great read! I hated for it to end because now I can't keep guessing about how it ends.

This was truly one of the most interesting and enthralling books I have read in recent months. The shift in the storytelling from one character to another was handled very smoothly. The story did not go in the direction that I expected to go. I think direction Mr. Smitherd took was much more frightening and intriguing. I will be looking for future novels from Smitherd.

I really enjoyed this book, the characters are very likable and the story is extremely fluid. The only complaint I had was the ending, which if you read enough towards the end, you get an alternate which I liked a lot better.
Very interesting! Missed some hours of sleep not being able to put the book down.  It's worthy of at least a try.

I thoroughly enjoyed reading this. Engaging from beginning to end ( I did like the alternate ending a bit better and would love to read the expanded version of it). Ive read several other self published authors and usually end up feeling like the stories are incomplete.. or rushed. Not so with "The Stone Man". Ive already downloaded "The Black Room" and am very much looking forward to more! Keep up the good work Luke!!!

This isn't some rehashed old story line. The premise is fresh. It's been a while since I've read a book that was abed to put down and this one kept me wondering what was going to happen next. Do yourself a favor and check it out!
I really enjoyed this authors writing style.  It was a good story and I loved the characters and how they interacted.

OK Im being silly but got your attention. This yarn was well written from a british author. Some of his story had a delicate colloquial flavor in his attempts to describe scenery and action. This added to the setting in Coventry. I liked the story immensely. Murf
I don't have much to add to the other positive reviews here, other than to say that if you are a science fiction, this book deserves your attention.

Not a fan of horror, but then I wouldn't necessarily classify this as horror.  Maybe a techno thriller, or first contact, or alien invasion.  In any case, a thoroughly enjoyable read with a unique angle and plot twists that surprised me.  This book should be submitted for an award.

I will not repeat what others have said before me, but I will say I started this book yesterday and could not put it down!  I was captured by the characters, Andy, of course, and then Paul.  I actually cared about what happened to them.  Any book that can keep my attention the  way The Stone Man did deserves 5 stars in my humble opinion.  I did go to the very last page and read the alternate ending.  I did want some kind of closure.  The only disappointment I have with the book is that I wanted to know more about where and why The Stone Man, and then the others, came to our planet.  Heck, I still want to know!

I've been on a reading kick lately, having read many sci-fi books by lesser-known authors over the last few months.  This book nailed the balance of a perfect read- a great story which is told in enough detail to keep you interested and able to picture the scenes without becoming a difficult read because of too much detail.  The characters develop nicely and are very relatable.  Once I submit this review, I will be immediately looking for more books by Mr. Smitherd.

Good and interesting book, well written, with clarity and introspection into the minds of the two main characters. I enjoyed it, but the use of the word "stood" throughout the book when "standing" was the correct word, drove my poor editor/proofreader self crazy!

Wow...just wow!  Hard, "techy" science fiction at its best!  So you can forget about the reports that "classic" SF is dead; this is a crackling good story with excellent characters & development and just the right emotional tone.  This young author is as good as Asimov, Clarke and Lymington and that's saying a lot!  (Who's John Lymington, you ask, youngsters?  An excellent British SF writer back in the 60s.)  Thanks for your art, Mr. Smitherd!

This book gets 4 stars. Had it not been for a slightly slow start, or better yet let's say a blurry start, it would've been a 5 star read. Overall a smart, well written story. I really got the feeling I "knew" the characters and would try to picture myself in their place(s). If it was the intent of the author to encourage the reader to ask themselves "What would I do" then he accomplished this many times. In my mind this book questions much about our society as a whole. Overall a very good read.
The Stone Man had a refreshingly  unusual premise, which I enjoyed.  It was entertaining from beginning to end. I would definitely read other books by this author!

Quite the concept. I must say I have not stumbled across such an outside the box scenario over the years. I enjoyed your indirect treatment which created a fine flow for the reader. It was difficult to put the book down from paragraph to paragraph.
Very enjoyable book, blazed through it over the weekend, really left me wanting more(even after reading the alt ending), maybe a sequel one day? =)

This is always an interesting concept, the unknown be it paranormal or extraterrestrial. This is what made this book a good read. I also enjoyed the normal ness of the character.  Very nice read keep more of these books coming.

It takes a lot to scare me, being a voracious horror and science fiction reader, but The Stone Man did in spades.  There is something about a giant, featureless man of stone plowing through buildings, relentlessly pursuing its target, that makes me shudder with delight.  I can almost feel the ground tremble and hear the terrible screeching sound as it approaches.  Thanks, Luke, for this book.  I look forward to checking out your other works.

overall this was an enjoyable read, especially when you consider that the author is new. I liked the pace of the book. It kept my interest all the way until the ending. The "Stone Man" itself was described in a way that I couldn't help but see it in my minds eye, like a modern day golem.  Very entertaining read.
Liked the alternate ending, good free read rather slow at some times cool twist I did not see coming, I recommend this book.

Loved The Stone Man! Highly recommend this book and found it to be very original. It kept me clicking my kindle pages late into the night because I just couldn't stop reading it. Still keep thinking about it 2 weeks later! I also bought all of his other books and will review those as I go.
I love the first person narrative and the storyline is definitely thrilling.  I also enjoy a story, like this, that leaves some mystery and motive yet to be resolved.  I'm glad I bought it!

Enjoyed the story a lot until the end. Wrong guy survived, wrong guy came up with the great idea. I think taking the original ending would be great and just stop when a new stone man appears. But still enjoyed the story. What would have happened if he had stayed in NY? Hmmm?
I  liked this. Read it over a week and found myself thinking about it many times when I wasn't  reading .

This was an amazing book!  Couldn't put it down!  I got so entrenched in this story that I just had a hard time getting anything else done.  Great storyline, great characters, great everything.  Sci-fi at it's best!!

I have never written a review before, but this book is "amazing"  Could not put it down.  Had to download the rest of Luke's books immediately and have just finished "The Black Room" Parts 1-4.  Another 2 nights of reading non-stop!  Highly recommend this book if you like being entertained with suspense and what the H is going on here.  And yes, Luke, I liked the endings...both of them.
Great story, AND led to the next one I'm going to read. The Black Room.....Hope it's as good as this one

Not my usual genre but it sounded really interesting. I was hooked right from the beginning. A totally different scare factor in this book. Not another recycled, same-old story.  Loved the authors commentary at the end too!
Great science fiction thriller. I loved the characters and the character development. Kept me turning the pages until the end.

I found it well written and intriguing to the end.  But what was unique about this book that i have not seen done well in other books, was that it felt like a three act play.  Each act a standalone story arc.  Most other books that try it come out long and eventually boring, or the acts arent really standalone.  This book managed to be three well written books intriguing to each end.  Excellent job.
Really on par with mainstream science-fiction novels. I enjoyed it immensely. This author is a rising star of the self-published book world.

It was a little hard to understand the book at the beginning but it was because it was written by a Brit.  I guess we speak American. LOL.  Anyway I finally got the hang of it.  I reallly loved the book.  The story is scaring, heartwarming and so terrifying I kept seeing the Stone Man following me in my dreams.  The story reminded me of a scary Twilight Zone story.  Read it but I warn you.  The Stone Man might just catch up with you and you are going to be hurting.
good job, luke. i enjoyed your book. please write more about the stone men and their story for us next.
Echoing an earlier reviewer - reminiscent of Wyndham which is big praise indeed, and also reminded me of J.G. Ballard.
Very unique and entertaining. Keeps you guessing and on the edge of your seat. The author's afterword introduces you to the author's humor and his insight into the book.
Very original storyline, keeps you on the edge of your seat. Wasn't too keen on the ending, but over all really well done.

First time reading anything by this author. I found the storyline to be quite interesting and well written and I will be looking for more of his books. There are some typos, but nothing too distracting. Very good book overall.

I thoroughly enjoyed this one, it didn't start off really fast paced but it was steady and built up nicely.  I am a little let down at the ending, but I'm hoping that it was left that way for a follow up? I guess I'm torn about how I feel about the the open ending...I get it, but it really made me want more!

A unique premise and very well written. Definitely worth a read. Grotesque without being grisly, horrific and psychodramatic. I have only two small issues. 1. The author has one character with Aspergers and his portrayal seems inconsistent. As I have Aspergers myself, I noticed this. 2. Andy's solution is very doable. Paul's seems improbable if not impossible. But these issues did not distract from a good story.  Try it.
I really enjoyed the book, though I almost didn't read it because of the title.  Intriguing concept!  I was put off by how many times the author used the word "whilst."  Maybe it's an English thing.
Kept my interest and was hard to put down.  Bizarre ending.  Would like to have seen the stone destroyed though
One of the good ones.  Excellent science fiction.  Many times the low cost/free ebooks disappoints but this was hard to put down. I will be looking for more of this author"s work.

I give this book 4 stars simply because The Black Room is my favorite so far. Although TSM is very original and very well written. It could get confusing at times (especially the ending?). I will still keep reading Smitherd simply because he knows how to weave a good tale and make it very intense! Now on to TMOTT.

I really enjoyed this novel and thought the writing and characterization were excellent.  I am a fan of sic-fi stories which take place in ordinary real life settings, with every day people who are suddenly thrown into extraordinary and mysterious situations.  Put it this way - I LOVE John Wyndham novels!  Reading the Stone Man was like discovering a John Wyndham book I hadn't read before. It had the same creepy, spine tingling feel which I love, especially when contrasted with the typically English setting and quintessentially English characters, and while I had some reservations about the ending, it was consistent with the storyline and entirely unpredictable. Highly recommended to lovers of classic sic fi novels.

This was a really good story that grabbed me and held my attention.  Although there was no definitive resolution, it was complete enough so that you could fill in the rest with your imagination.  Good characters and realistic (given the sci-fi domain)  plot.  The author has real talent as a story teller.  You really care about what happens next.

It starts out by promising you'll learn answers, but you never do.  Grammatical and spelling errors galore.  Holds your interest, however, and writer definitely has a good imagination.  Interesting ending, but I felt 'ripped' off because there are really no answers to any of the questions that come up during the reading of this book.

A very different story, but one that really kept my interest.  I really enjoyed how the character interaction and self reflection developed throughout the story. I'm not sure which ending I prefer ( people generally want resolution, but I think in this case, it really works leaving it ambiguous).  I will definitely read more by Luke.

I did enjoy the story as it built and thought the plot was good, but found myself skipping over paragraphs and even pages in my quest to find the story.  Too much rhetoric and not enough content.  It almost seems like he was paid by the word.  My suggestion for future novel is to pare down the rhetoric and give us a story.

Excellent book. Started reading it several months ago and couldn't really get into it. Internet was out this weekend and couldn't download any new books so started reading it again. So glad I did because this time it pulled me in and I could hardly put it down. I thought it was well written and imaginative.

Most original plot ever. Extremely exciting and imaginative. Well fleshed characters, one comes to care for them..I almost never write reviews but this author is quite amazing. I just know this will be a movie and I hope they don't ruin it, but Mr King has nothing on you, Mr Smitherd. Keep it coming!!!

the read was a bit slow at forst, but then I had to see where the story went.  The main character is developed and, as it speaks of itself, not loveable but human. The story is mysterious but relentless and the switch from the main character first person to the second is an effective literary device..

What would happen if suddenly a gigantic stone man appeared and started smashing it's way across the country?  Who's mind even asks that kind of question?  Very cool.  The set-up for the story certainly gives the author a lot to work with.  The characters were well developed and believable.  The response of the military was realistic.  I don't think the press was well portrayed.  From what I've heard about the British tabloids they would have been a lot more aggressive but we'll let this one slide.  Still, a very realistic portrayal of a very unrealistic situation.  There was enough action to keep you interested but enough plot to give you something to think about after reading a chapter.  Sadly the story was simply too bleak for my taste.  Brave people going to their death for the greater good.  People being driven insane by an all-powerful, unstoppable superior force.  Be chased to death by an unstoppable creature.  I think the worst part of the story was the absolute sense of hopelessness.  Not that I need a hollywood ending every time.  I know not all stories end "happy".  But our characters should have SOME sense of hope.  If they are smart and brave they should be able to come up with something other than suicide as a solution.  The one character who finds a "solution" that allows him to live has it even worse than the ones who died.  The author presents an "alternative" ending - the original ending - in the final page of the book but explains that he abandoned that ending for one with more punch.  Seriously?  Oh well - he's the author and it's his story.  He can end it any way he likes.  For me, I think I'm going to print this one out, rip up the ending and paste back in the original.  Far better.  But as it is, this book was just not my cup of tea.  I wanted to give this book 1 star because I really didn't enjoy it at all.  I have to admit it's very well written and should probably get 5 stars.  There's no star system that says "Great Book - Hated it" so I settled for an unsatisfactory 3 stars.  Which really is a cop-out because it's not a mediocre book.  It's either great or terrible.

An intriguing premise that ultimately isn't very fulfilling. Without giving too much away, I was disappointed in the ending that provided little resolution, and in the way the story was told mostly from the viewpoint of a single character that then switched to another character near the end.

Though this seemed like it was of interest when I first read the synopsis; I didn't get more than 30 pages in and the premise was unappealing to me.  It was very slow moving, as well.  There lacked hints of things to come that would pique my interest.  I just hope I didn't pay for it.

Smitherd has created a story that is different in so many ways. So much of science fiction and horror is repetitive, it's great to read something as unpredictable and engaging as The Stone Man. To Mr. Smitherd I say, "Thank you, sir. It was a totally enjoyable ride. Godspeed."

Original premise, good plot development, enjoyed the book.  I liked the alternative ending in the epilogue a lot more than the original as I prefer questions raised in the plot fully answered. Would like to see a sequel that clears up all the remaining things left to your imagination.
Very interesting but needs an ending.

Luke Smitherd produced a very imaginative scifi thriller with his book The Stone Man. While the ending left me disappointed and the author sometimes ‘over developed’ his characters the plot for the story was unique. I look forward to other innovative stories from him in the future.

What a great classic sci fi story!  Reminds you of the black and white movies back in the day, with a twist.  He shows real people in impossible situations.  No stand out heroes here.  Makes it more 'real' for me.  I read this one before the Black Room series, and it got me hooked.

Nice first book.  A bit slow,  perhaps, but interesting and thoughtful. As to editing, speaking as an editor (jschool and all), I'm afraid editing has become a lost art. Editing of most modern stuff is pathetic. This one, in point of fact, is better edited than many. I enjoyed it.

I don't read a lot of sci-fi, but this one drew me in.  Great concept, solid execution, and I thought the ending was spot on (if you don't, the original outline's ending is included as well).  Overall a enjoyable read from a 2nd time novelist.  Can't wait to read his 3rd book.

Weak, inconsistent plot devices, characters who are frustrating for their lack of insight and creativity, I"m afraid all reflect poorly on the author.  It started off very well, but the ending was frankly shabby at best, with increasing let downs as the story moved on.

A very satisfying read. I was curious as to the title and the brief description when I first came across it. Purchased it and couldn't put it down! Well done and highly entertaining, the characters went through major ups and downs right to the end. I enjoyed it very much.

Wonderfully different...sci-fi concepts that are rarely explored. In the end, as with any good sci-fi, the science is secondary to the exploration of the self/human - conditions.  Sounds trite but that's what good stories come down to. Good stuff here...really enjoyed it.

Good Concept but fell flat.  Neat ending  It had potential but I had to struggle to keep reading it.  To many times the author tried to tease you with the concept of something was going to happen or an idea that he just never revealed until much later that did not work.

Who dreams up this kind of story? The title caught my attention so I figured I give it a go. It managed to capture my attention within just a few pages. The narrative continued to unfold creatively; and I really enjoyed the ending. Thanks for such a good story.

Needs more technical specifics for it to really give you a sci-to feel that you're looking for but overall not a bad book. There are only 3 real characters in the book and I liked the development of all of them. If there was a follow up I would give it a read.

I really enjoyed this story, the author has a unique way of telling the story and captures your attention very quickly, at least for me anyway. And the plots are original which is not found to often these days. Hope he keeps writing, he's got a new fan here.

I do not read science fiction but am so glad I chose this book as my first.  I could not put this story down. The way the author writes makes you feel you are actually there,clenched teeth and all. Even if you are not a sci fi fan., this book is a must read.

Good read. Interesting story line that is different than other Sci-Fi books out currently. Keeps and holds your interest throughout the entire story, wish that there was more of a conclusion to the story though. All together, very good and worth the read.

This would have been an interesting book if it had led somewhere.  If you ignore the typos, parts were well written.  But it was just the first couple of chapters of a book, stretched to make it the length of a complete book, but without adding anything.

The characters were interesting and the mystery intriguing enough to hold my interest and keep me turning pages. The 2 main characters were dynamic and, without giving away the ending, I was surprised by their outcomes. It was an unexpected twist.

I really enjoyed this book. Good science fiction story with an air of mystery about it. A strong but flawed main character, well described setting, and strong pace kept me turning the pages to find out what happened next. Strongly recommended.

Stone Man is Avery original concept for an alien encounter including the government response. It is an enjoyable story but the ending is not up to the energy level as the rest of the story.  You will enjoy the mixture of characters.

Movie moguls better buy the rights to this book...it would be as good, if not better, than Michael Crichton's Jurassic Park...it grabbed you...I spent a whole day, just devouring this book...Luke Smitherd is OUTSTANDING...read it

A different sort of science fiction novel. The Stone Man is engaging and thought provoking. The premise is unusual, the characters multidimensional and authentic and the ending satisfactorily open ended. Quite an enjoyable read.

Very good idea , well exploited. The beginning is highly captivating; then it settles in a more repetitive way. The ending is somehow 'open', but smart. Very pleasant reading (ignoring the overabundant use of four letter words).

Engaging story, less "science" and more "fiction", but it really kept me wanting to read more.  So many scifi books these days seem to follow a similar mold, but this story was completely off the beaten path.

quite original, paced like the inexorable approach of the stone man itself, great identification with very humanly flawed characters, I think this one will be unforgettable, feels like a classic.  i give it 5 stars

A great and exciting book.  More than science fiction, a good look at how government might react to an alien presents .  I would like a better ending however, neither one given by the author does the book justice.

This book needs to be made into a movie or at least an HBO/Showtime/Netflix or better yet an Amazon miniseries- it's that good. Just don't change the location or try to move it to Burbank, keep it in the UK!

I read books all the time. But this... I must see what else this author writes.  The subject the characters.  This is writing.  There are so many crappy books out there. This is an amazing and scary story

I love science fiction, but often, my interest wanes, and I move on to the next book before finishing. Not so with The Stone Man, an original idea that kept my interest to the end. Next, The Black Room.
Okay...this book is what made me a "Smithereen." It was absolutely riveting! From this book I was inspired to read the rest of your books...keep writing because I certainly want to keep reading!
You never know what is going to happen next!  Though, I admit, I did think I wasn't getting that alternate ending, good thing I read the excerpts!!  It really is at the very end of the book, folks!!
