I found it hard to put the book down. I enjoyed the British vernacular and Andy's first person viewpoint. Can't wait for more of your work. Thanks for a good read and an escape to another place. TMS
A little plodding, there could've been more...lots of room for a sequel. I wish there had been more of an ending but the character development and mystery are enough to get you through to the end.
Well written.  Held my attention throughout the book.  I especially liked how all the different characters and events meshed well in the story about such divergent characters, events, and places.
The Stone Man was hard to put down. It was very suspenseful, the dialog and characters were believable, and the ending was satisfying. I look forward to reading more books by Luke Smitherd.
Great read!!  Such an odd premise, and yet a terrific story was created around it.  I'm a picky reader,  and found the dialog and characters to be extremely believable.  Highly recommended!
Read this through in one setting. Be warned... it is different, but mesmerizing.  I read this and then instantly purchased every Kindle book by Luke Smitherd .  Definitely not average.
Really enjoyed this book.  I dont post many reviews and sadly (shame on me) they are typically for the ones that make me nuts.  I highly recommend.  You will enjoy the time spent.
What a slow silly story. Certainly won't buy something from this author again if that is the way that he writes. Disappointment.
the story is a bit unbelievable but i am trying to suspend disbelief.  there is excitement and some interesting characters.  i am not finished with the book yet.  i am half way.
What a wild rambling ride of a story. Some clever original ideas, kept me entertained, and the ending, well the ending... ha ha blew my mind with the metaphorical possibilities!
As a Sci-Fi fan, this is a story of scary proportions. The sudden appearance followed by the walking through everything in it's path and being unstoppable. Great story! Read it!
Good sci-fi, I enjoyed The Stone Man. Great concept and well written. Looking for more books by L. Slithered. The ending.... well, you have to read for yourself...enjoy, I did.
I really, really enjoyed this book!  It was well written, the story line intriguing, and the ending  a total surprise.  Nice to read some mature science fiction for a change.
Up to 3am to finish this book!  A really good, thought provoking and imagination inspiring read.  One of those books you just keep thinking about once you've finished it!
Grabs you from the beginning and slowly lets you into the mystery but by the time you get close to the end, I almost forgot what I was reading for. Not terrible though.
They story felt like it was straight from the old TV series Twilight Zone. Would have liked to have learned more about the Stone Man, but a decent read despite that.
This was not what I was expecting but it turned out to be pretty thought provoking.  I thought the ending could have been stronger, but I would recommend to others.
Good old fashioned imaginative fiction. Haven't read anything as good as Luke's stories in decades. Well worth a read!! Well thought out ending but don't cheat!
This is a good read. Sci/fi, along with what seemed to be a nightmare that one could not wake up from, and being rather vague at first, makes a good story.
The storyline was very good, and character development was terrific.  There were a lot of editing errors, but I just skipped over them.  Read the book....
I really enjoyed reading "The Stone Man” by Luke Smitherd! Good exploration of an interesting concept. Well written and a fun read. Thanks Luke.
I really enjoyed the fast pace of this book. It held my interest throughout, and was equally intense, mysterious and suspenseful. Great story.
The initial concept was very interesting to me and the story is well-written, but the ending was disappointing and just kind of trailed off...
Original plot. Great characters. Good read. I especially liked the ending; didn't see it coming. I'm looking forward to more from this author.
Excellent story! Can't recommend highly enough. This is an original, fun, well-thought out story. Will be reading all of his other books soon.
A great read until the unending mystery.  Great characters, situations and drama.  Here's a talent that kept me reading and looking for more.
It started well. But lost its way. Could have added some spice to explain construction of atonement and scientific resolution of the problem.
This was a good read. Good detail and character development. Moves along nicely given all that.  I hope this author continues the good work.
A good read, but too verbose for the story at hand. It was written like Dickens when an economy of words would have done to tell the story.

I don't even want to give it one star.  It's so bad.  I want it to be better.  I think there's a good idea somewhere in there.  But I feel like I am reading someone's fantasy of being a cool reporter/famous person.  I'm skipping whole pages trying to get to the end, and I never do that!  90 percent of the book is gratuitous.  I agree with the reviewer who said that this could be a short story if they kept the extraneous stuff out.  I REALLY DO NOT NEED TO KNOW THAT YOU HAD SEX WITH SOMEONE'S WIFE.  It does nothing for the plot and makes me hate the protagonist.  The writing is forced - no one talks like that.  No one thinks like that.  The protagonist is an arrogant jerk.  All the characters have the same voice.  So much work needs to go into the editing.
The two main characters were so fleshed out and so interesting, I did not want the book to end. Very unique premise, yet quite believable.
This book made me nervous.  In the pit of my stomach there was a (what if this really happened) fear when reading this book.  I loved it.
Very good.  Keeps you turning the pages.  Thought I had the ending figured out  but was surprised. Will check out more books by author.
Read like a first try novel.  Interesting idea but lacking in direction.  Nothing to hold on to.  No one to root for.  Just plain bas.
Not bad, a little slow at the start but hard to put down once it got going.  I'm looking forward to reading more from Luke Smitherd.
Horrible.pointless very disappointed in the ending, after a long drawn out meandering story with no purpose except to bore me silly
This is a very imaginative tale, and a fun read with lots of inside-the-head business.  I'm going for more of this Smitherd stuff.
Completely unique storyline. Very well written. Entertaining; a real "page turner". I intend to look for more of his work.
Great Book!! Was very impressed. Couldn't wait to pick it up every chance I got. Bought 3 more of his books. Definitely recommend!
nice book easy read very entertaining cool plot would recommend it to others hope for a  sequal needs to be more scifi like this
Don't waste your time. It really was too silly without any reasonable explanations of WHO and WHY. Unlikable characters, too.
This was a very interesting book.  It seemed a little slow in spots but all in all was was a very suspenseful and scary read.
It's got a few spelling errors, but it is still a good read and a classic sci-fi tale. I hope to see more from this author.
Most original and entertaining read in years. Plot was fantasy, but characters were very strong. Looking forward to more.
Loved the book! Great story and great characters. Don't know why they need me to write so many words to post it though.
A strange read that was really different. Just didn't care for the ending. It just stopped with t bout a conclusion.
Interesting Sci-Fi without the technical jargon that comes with much of the genre. Good characters and storytelling.
Sci-fi at it's best. Entertaining, suspenseful, well developed. Made believable thru Smitherd's superb storytelling.
This is the second book,I have read of his. I have another new favorite author. Give it a read you won't be sorry.
I really enjoyed the story. Kept me interested. I loved the characters and their voices. Thanks for a great read.
A well thought out plot, from a simple idea. Fantastic characters well paced a a ton of surprises. A great read.
We'll written and interesting.  I enjoyed reading it.  In this case I'm not sure it would make a good series.
Quite innovative plot.  This was certainly different from the spy/chase thrillers that dominate out there
I really liked this book.  It was strange but kept me interested.  And I did really like the characters.
It's now nearly 6am and I just finished reading. My only complaint is that it is over. Read this book!
What a great concept! I wish a writer would have thought of it.
Excellent read. I'm looking forward to reading all of his work. You'll be glad you opened it.
Well done. I could not put it down. Hanging on to the edge of your seat right until the end.
One of the better sci-fi novels in the vein of Philip K. Dick.  Hard to put this one down.
A very different story! Told in a way that keeps you guessing. I truly enjoyed every page.
Awesome!  Real page turner. Didn't see it as horror really, but still pretty kick ass!
Interesting premise,would like to have had more info on the enemy or was it an enemy?
What a fun read! A very interesting and intriguing concept. I thoroughly enjoyed it.
intriguing enjoyable  book looking forward to reading more of this artists fiction

The Stone Man was a unique premise, and given the wealth of other glowing reviews, I gave it a shot. Sadly, the book was repetitive and tiresome to the point that I ended up skimming over large sections of the narrator's internal exposition as it had been said over and over and over again. The ending leaves much to be desired. By the time I got there, I didn't care; and, if I had, I would have been disappointed.
I'll be brief and kind: Much ado about nothing. I'm deleting it from my Kindle.
Great story, original, funy, and very likable characters. I highly recomend it.
Loved this book. I've been a long time sci-fi fan and this didn't disappoint!
Well written, fast paced with an unexpected twist. A very enjoyable read.
Totally different from anything I'd read before.  Frightening concept.
Repetitive and somewhat boring.  Haven't been motivated to finish it.

This was the first novel I have read by this author.  Oh my gosh!  The Stone Man is unlike anything I have read.  So original and so well written.  I couldn't put it down.  I read it in two days and then quickly bought the In The Black Room series today.  I am now into the second book.  All I can say is Smitherd has a very interesting imagination and a gift for putting it into words.
but a bit tedious of a read, without much empathy development for lead characters. also a somewhat unsatisfactory transition to second party narrator towards the end of the book.

I read the whole thing, hoping it would improve, but no luck. The author needed a good editor to cut out about 1/3 of the incessant description and the characters' boring internal monologues. The ending was a disappointment, but even worse was his alternate ending. He should have the guts to write one ending and stick to it. That shows no confidence in his own writing abilities. If he doesn't believe he can end a novel properly in one try, he shouldn't publish it.

The premise for this story was thrilling, but not suspenseful. Was the main character the secondary character or the other way around. All of a sudden the main character is not there anymore and the secondary character ends the story and we don't know anything about him. As usual an editor would have helped.
Not hard sci fi, but an enjoyable Twilight Zone romp. I admire the tenacity of indie novelists  and sincerely hope this one continues writing.

Great story, well written. Kept me engaged and entertained all the way through. At first, I hated that we never resolve more about the stone men, but the story is less about them than it is about Andy, and ultimately, Paul. The ending leaves it all open, so you finish in as much suspense as you were throughout the book. Luke Smitherd is now on my favorites authors list, both this and The Physics of the Dead are original, well told stories, and I'll be back for more by him! Definitely recommending this one.
Great book. Got a little slow towards the end but concluded nicely.
The book kept me reading, good plotline and character development.
Interesting concept and well written...thanks for the good read!
The most interesting book in a long time. Couldn't stop reading
Terrific read, excellent story, well done. Onto The Black Room!
A very enjoyable and fast read.  I didn't want to put it down.
Outstanding science fiction. I recommend this book highly!
Good read. Definitely goIng to read another of his books.
This book held my interest for hours. It was a good read.
First book I have read by Smitherd.  I really liked it.
Kept me reading. Characters portrayal very believable.
Was a decent read.  Didn't care for the ending though.
Fascinating story!!! I could not put this book down!!
An imaginative story with some interesting twists.
Great Book.I wonder where these ideas spring from.
First half was interesting; then it went downhill.

55 years of reading SF, and I rate this in the top 10 books! The characters are real & grow into their places in a truthful manner.  The concept of the "stone man" I find unique and thought provoking.  Intriguing ending including a small twist.
Not bad at all. I'll check out his other stuff.

It has been a long time since I have not completed a book. This is written in first person, and I kept waiting for it to get better. By the fourth chapter I couldn't go on any more.  Very slow moving,  to say the least.
Slow starter. You just have to stay with it.

A thoroughly enjoyable read from start to finish. Really loved the concept, really engaged with the narrative, I used to live in Coventry too, which helped me visualise the story. Very clever storytelling. Bravo Luke.
Not as good as other books I've read by him
Very entertaining, I hated to stop reading.
Good kept me reading till late at night
Weirdly Different. I enjoyed it alot.
A quick read, I couldn't put it down.
great concept. weak ending. Nice try.

Very good read and highly engaging.
I usually loge all books: go thru them in a day or two. This one took me a week. I don't know what it was but it did not grab my attention. I was not crazy about it.
was as described and was enjoyed

not a book I will read again.

Outstanding fiction.
this guy can write!
Different but good

I'd like to know where all the 5 star reviews are coming from.  I tried to finish this book, I really did, but the totally anticlimactic actions of the adversary at the middle of the book especially after all the foreshadowing in the previous chapters, had me almost throwing my kindle across the room. And when it takes almost 6 pages for the main character to break through a door, you know your dealing with one bloated novel.  On the plus side, there were no spelling or other errors, and if the author could of kept from describing everything in the most minute detail, it would of been a good novel.  Wish I could return this and get my money back.  That's what I get for not reading the sample first.
Big disappointment. Slow read, not particularly suspenseful. Counting pages til it was over. Imaginative but silly plot that's not tied together.

Couldn't begin to finish this book.  Just too awful.  The writer must have had an "F" word key to just add it in for no apparent reason.  Only gave this one star because it was a book.  Other than that there are just no words in my vocabulary to give any other description.

I purchased this before taking a look at the reviews. There were many reviews showing multiple stars. Now that I have read about a third of it I am putting it down and will not finish it. The writing seems to go on and on and not say anything of importance. The plot doesn't advance. Finally in exasperation I read some of the one and two star reviews and found that this is a common experience. Then I read that the book doesn't have an ending. Unlike others, I did pay for this. Only book I have paid for that I wish I could send back.
Great read!!!

Who are they? What do they want? I want to know where these "things" originated. What is the rest of the world doing in response to the visitors? These questions are not answered, they are "begged." Book ends with vague suppositions and more questions. Also book is bedeviled by grammatical errors, most distracting. And do not tease me with an "alternative ending." Time to step back and edit the premise of the story. I'll be very interested to see a revised edition.
A good read.
Great read.
Enjoyed it.
Great story
Good read.
Good book.
Good read. Reminds of Jules Verne novels. No instant gratification. The progression is slow and deliberate . The only thing I did not like is excessive - imho - use of expletives.

I read this one taking the authors advice after reading knives, well I think it's great. Waiting for it to come out on hbo! Keep the fingers flying with your mind, they work well together. You have one more fan.
A must read. Couldn't put it down. The stuff bad dreams are made of. Could keep you up day and night!
Excellent, original story.  Ignore bad reviews.  This is a very kool story with good character development and pace.  Enjoyed it very much.

'The Stone Man' is well written and makes you not want to put it down. It really makes one wonder what other life is out there in the vast universe. It illustrates the ingenuity of the human species when challenged.

As an avid reader, it is great when an author comes up with bold new ideas, as Luke Smitherd did.  I hope you enjoy it as much as I did.  PS.  This is the first time I have ever written a review of any book, and I have read hundreds; That should tell you something!
I enjoyed every page. This book was my introduction to the author and i can see that it's only the first. looking forward to more.

The Stone Man had me hooked, it's definitely worth reading. It's one of the most grounded scifi stories I've read, it's almost believable, almost. Thank you for the ride Luke, I will now happily try some of your other books

Tightly written but ended up going no where. The main character suddenly kills himself part way through and it is picked up by his psychic partner as the tale teller. No real explanation for the aliens and what they were up to was provided and the ending was a let down.

I love the title, I love the author's name but, what's it all about Alfie?  This is a perfectly stupid book written by a pasty limey with British phrases which sometimes went over my head and other times were easy enough to figure out.  Had I "realised" rather than "realized" it was British I am very sure I would not have spent the $0.99 for the terrific sounding book.  It was very slow to start.  I fell asleep, began again where the tablet turned off the night before and had to go back and re-read several pages and it still didn't make sense.  I LOVE science fiction but I think this is what happens to a young mind with the aid of alcohol.  Keep writing and perhaps find some better drugs to produce something more interesting.

The premise was interesting, but the story telling was disjointed.  The sudden switch between characters was particularly jarring and really made me start to lose interest.  The ending was predictable as well.
I like the concept but too little detail about the stone men is revealed, too slowly. I get that they are a mystery but for my taste too much time spent with character backstories.

Of course I was interested right away and thought that the story told from the reporters perspective would be novel.  However, I was disappointed in the ending.  I just expected there to be more to the story.  It was kind of like a balloon slowly losing air - all shiny and colorful and then just deflated......
I  had trouble in staying intrested. Hard to follow.  Changing front did not help. After section 1 it got better.
As I said enjoyed it.  Seemed a little plodding at times.  And we never find out why the Stone Man came.

The story of two men caught up in a confusing and deadly first contact situation. While we only see the aliens' artificial constructs and never learn their ultimate goals, the unlikely partners find themselves psychically bound to those constructs and key figures in the effort to limit the damage done by the linear behavior of the Stone Men. The story is a journey of self-discovery by the two as they try to cope with a devastating situation.
Good read

Some other reviewers said that parts were to long and wordy.  I also skipped over them.  I would really like to see shorter chapters.  That said, I really liked the story and the author's conversational way of writing.  Action was good.  Liked the second ending.  Good book!

I tried. I really did. But after a week and a half I'd only read a fifth of the book. I gave up. It was just too slow for me. I'm sure that if I had been patient I might have found a way to get through the book.

Took forever to get into the plot. If I am completely bored after the first 50 pages of a book, I toss it and go to the next one. Perhaps it was the author's writing style or that I am an impatient reader. Whatever. I noted that the book received many positive reviews but I cannot concur since I did not finish it.
Is it sci-fi, horror, mass fear and panic, epic destruction, or a wonderfully inventive new thrill ride. Regardless of how one describes it, you'll find it hard to put down.
writing sounds like a guy babbling non-stop, much of it uninteresting and irrelevant to the story. found the incessant babbling to be a turn off.

Mr. Smitherd has a wonderful imagination and puts in just the right amount of character information that we really enjoy his stories. What might be a mundane story line actually was an extremely hard to put down book. I have just read another novella of his and as expected the plot was original, people interesting, and unperticable right to the end. Smitherd is my new favorite easy read author!

this book is a good read but does drag along at parts. The concept is good as science fiction goes but I was disappointed the way the main characters played out. The ending was sad and left me feeling empty for some sort of closure.
Do not bother, like reading the news...5th grade. Please do not waste your time, sorry to the author, but this is bad.
Just very boring, I did not finish the book. I waited for something new to happen, and I waited for....
Overdeveloped characters, underdeveloped story. A disappointing read.
I became an instant fan.  Terrific writing, great concept.
For me it seemed to lengthy.
Couldn't get passed the first forty pages.... Way too much needless profanity.
Way too predictable
a different plot

Sorry I was hoping this book with be faster paced and not so much blah blah blah inbetween the action.  There was too much information for me.  It seemed to ramble on and on about everything.  I like a book that moves faster.  I think the idea for the story was great and wish I could've enjoyed it.  I endured to about 36% and then quit.  I will be deleting this book.

I would most likely give this book a higher rating, IF I WERE ABLE TO FINISH IT!  Half way through the novel, it just "ended".  I got an error message saying it didn't download properly.  No luck trying to re-download without paying for the priviledge.  So, I'll never know how the story ended because I refuse to pay for what I've already paid for....one free book a month as an Amazon Prime member.  Sure hope this doesn't happen again as I'm having trouble with the lending library at Amazon.  I'm afraid to even click on a book for information about it, or read a sample of it, these days.  Amazon quietly puts a charge for it on my credit card without my knowledge or permission!  No "Thanks for your Purchase" screen or any confirmation at all that they just put a charge on my card.  That's why I closed my credit card with them.  Why would I pay for a book I can read for free?  They've just a bit too free and easy with using my card.  No more.

I chose this rating because of the constant use of F****.  It isn't necessary.  It only shows a lacking in the author's vocabulary.  Also, why do British authors seem to use a British dialect, while other European authors use more of a neutral English dialect.  Sorry, but the constant use of "whilst" is very distracting to me.

Short on action, not much happens, got bored and quit reading after three chapters . A stone man appears and starts walking thru the city ,destroying everything in it's path. Then the author starts talking about the main characters feelings. Sorry old man,still boring to read, even on a cold winter day
The book starts out interesting but the constant confusion, emotional overload wears thin quick. Had to fight thru to halfway or so but admitted defeat and deleted it. Just couldn't finish it
none

Was an interesting concept and fairly decent writing with believable characters.  The ending seemed a bit abrupt so possibly a sequel in the making here?

I made it about halfway through this book before I gave up.  Life's too short to plod through a book about a stone man that walks a straight line.  I kept waiting for something to happen or be revealed.
This is the dullest, slowest, least engaging book I have read for a very long time.  I gave it up at 20%.
Slow moving and main character is too pedestrian. I'd have to shoot myself if my life was as boring as main character--looser.

After 20 pages and 50 F***ing adjectives, I didn't like reading the book.  Perhaps a unique idea and interesting writing style, but should be a warning on language - there are other ways to express yourself.
Possibly the worst 'horror' story I have ever read.  Definately the worst 'science-fiction' story I have ever read. Dull beyond belief!
Can't believe I even finished this book - even the ending was about as poor & dumb as the whole book.

Sorry, was a huge let down. Started strong but got long winded with little so called horror. Gave it a chance.
Some books you can tell if they are any good within the first few pages. I like Science fiction, BUT THIS BOOK USED THE "F " WORD SO MANY TIMES, I QUIT READING IT. THERE WAS NO NEED FOR IT.
